reviews.text:
I visited Dahab with my family and was not sure where to go for food. My family just arrived and are bit 'picky', but I wanted to take them somewhere special. 

I met Magdy on the boulevard and  he invited us to his place Lidia Restaurant and recommended the Kabab Halla  a sort of Egyptian slow cooked beef stew with rice and salad.
My mum uttered  'This is the best meal I ever had!!' and starting chatting with Magdi.  ... so... we ended up eating there every other day!  Loved it!
reviews.title: Good Food, very nice people

name: El Hana Cafe
rankingString: #89 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text:
Everything was perfect!
The owner and waiter are so nice!  They will make you the conversation as much as you want.  Always smiling, always proud of their restaurent.
Many seats just by the sea, with the sound of waves. You can eat something, then walk into the sea, and come back take a tea!
The price of food is fair. It's part of the cheapest places where you can relax and eat in a good atmosphere.
reviews.title: Very nice owner, nice waiter and amazing food in an amazing setting

reviews.text: wonderful place to eat in amazing surroundings plenty of shade and sunshine or just lazing on a sun lounger on the pebble beach. perfect for snorkellers and divers close to plenty of dive sites. good for young children my kids loved the hammock and swing and i have been told Gamal is going to make a sandpit.the food was fresh and tasted good the staff were easy to approach friendly and always helpful and agreeable to your personal requests even if not on the menu. a serene spot to relax and spend the day i look forward to returning next year
reviews.title: perfect place to spend a quiet day

reviews.text:
We were diving the sites of "Golden Blocks", "Moray Garden" and "the Caves" and our dive guide reccomended we spent our rest time in the company of El Hana cafe. Its a small family run "bedouin" style cafe offering fresh Juices, cold and hot drinks snacks and meals 

We visited on 2 occasions. The first time I had grilled fresh fillet of fish with rice and grilled vegetables and my wife had vegetable rice with a side of hummous and freshly made bread. Our secong visit my wife ate a selection of local specialitys including Freshly made flat bread, Falafal, Foul-falaf (like re-fried beans) dips and fried bread sticks (this wasnt a menu item but the owner of the cafe was happy to oblige the request and have the chefs knock up an interesting selection) I went for a chicken pizza (as I was planning to help my wife with hers!!)

On both occasions our food was hot and delicious. The service was always friendly and prompt. The drinks always as you would hope. The tea was hoy (I like the Bedouin tea) and the juices cold and fresh)

We enjoyed our time very much there and would definatly choose this spot when next visiting happy village in southern Oasis, Dahab. 

The menu is great value and a well reccomend spot, sat right on the sea egde with sun bathing, snorkeling and swimming.

Chukran
reviews.title: Great Place to eat & chill

reviews.text: we went there several times we enjoyed the food, the company, view, food comes fantastic we had a chicken barbeque , we sit by the sea,it was very nice everybody serves u with a smile .if u visit Dahab you must go to EL HANA CAFE i promise you wont regret it
reviews.title: unforgettable day

reviews.text:
We waited for our dishes to come for more  than an hour.
When finally got them discovered that most of them were too small in content. 
When we got the bill we discovered that they added 14% tax (which wasn’t mentioned anywhere! and wasn’t charged from us in any other restaurant) to prices which initially appeared extremely high.
Talking to the owner about it we felt like literally dealing with Alcapone himself.
We ended up disappointed, hungry and with a feeling of being cheated.
Our strong advice - look for better value for money experience somewhere else.

reviews.text: We went to the place  the two of us  on our usual good expectations of the pizza what happened is that we asked the waiter Kareem to try the steak if it's fresh and taste good he immediately recommended the rip eye and strangely short rips (it wasn't on the menu) then we wondered if we gonna add pizza to the two steaks gonna be too much he said no its totally fine and didn't mention that the rip eye is huge can easily be shared by three persons plus the rip eye we told him we want it medium it came out raw no even rare RAW so we send it back and still taste awful as for the rip eye it tasted horrible and stale the pizza was fine except he put such a huge pile of arugula over it ...over all it was extremely pricey and not recommended at all

reviews.text: I am celiac and ate here twice during my stay in Dahab, both times I had a pizza with gluten free base, it was really nice to be able to eat somewhere with confidence that I wasn’t going to be glutened! It has a nice low key vibe and the staff were excellent.
reviews.title: Gluten free options were great!!

reviews.text: Pizza was average at best. It was soggy and kind of tasteless, the dough seemed almost undercooked. Service was slow. This would of been fine had the price not have been double the average pizza price in dahab. The issue is not paying this price, this issue is paying this price for mediocre food and service. Although the restaurant itself was nicely designed.
reviews.title: Average pizza for exhoberant price

reviews.text: Very disappointed with the food and service. We only had pizza, so maybe the rest is OK . It started with no glass going with the water. When I went to bar to ask for glasses  there was not even a sorry or I eill bring it for you, then pizza which was ruined with too much cheese to taste anything, although the ingredients seemed of good quality.  No service coming to the table anymore to check if anything else was needed. I
reviews.title: No heart for hospitality

reviews.text:
I honestly don’t know where to start. There is something super special about this place that makes you fall in love with it the moment you see it. I don’t know if it’s the place or the people, maybe it’s both. The moment we arrived we had a very warm welcome from the extremely friendly yet professional staff. The room was super clean and everything works extremely well. We accidentally broke the bathroom doorknob but as soon as we asked for help it got taken care of, faster than we wished for. The food there is literally “made with love”, their pizza is like no other, the dough is everything! the topping is fresh and tasty, I even took my leftovers back home “you can’t throw that away!” The place turns really cozy at night with the lights, the music, and again the warm smiles from their staff. 
I really enjoyed my vacation at Eldorado and I’ll be back sooner than I’ve planned for.
reviews.title: Like no other…

reviews.text: Came here for a few days and stayed for 3 weeks! The room is super nice, the food out of this world and the service among the best we have had in Dahab! The guys are super nice, the service is great and the place is totally child friendly. Our little one loves it. Can only highly recommend ❤
reviews.title: Came and never left

reviews.text: We have been here a few times now and are always happy to go back. By far the best pizza we have had in Egypt by far. Seating is nice and very close to a lot of places.
reviews.title: Great pizza in Egypt.

reviews.text:
Really good pizza! And I'm an Italian pizza lover! =) It is not the Neapolitan style pizza (with soft crust that almost melts in your mouth) but more like a Sicilian/southern Italian pizza with crunchy crust. The ingredients are really fresh and good. They also like to stuff the pizza pretty well with a thick layer of them!!!
We tried 3 different kinds and our favorite was the last one in the menù, the one called "if you didn't find your pizza yet, then this is the one"!!!
The owner Vincenzo and all the staff are really friendly.
Prices are pretty high if you compare to local food. You basically pay the same price you would pay in Italy for a pizza.
But it's true that if you want good quality food you should expect to pay well for it.
Next time we'll try the Tiramisù!! =)
reviews.title: Really good pizza!

reviews.text: I’ve eaten here a couple of times and the food has been very good. Excellent service and a lovely space and atmosphere.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text:
We went there for more than one night and we enjoyed it always.
We had dinner several times there and it was good always: the burgers, the calamari, the pasta, the shrimps, everything was good, fresh, and tasty.
It's also a good place to have some beers and enjoy a pleasant night in Dahab.
When I come back to Dahab, I'll definitely eat there again.
reviews.title: Tasty food and good beer next to the beach.

reviews.text: Churchills is located at the red sea relax hotel. A good view from the terrace, ideal for enjoying the deco beer after diving. Food is also very good here. Sometimes a bit windy, empty glasses may get blown from the table. Sadly during my visit some guests where a bit drunk and tried to started a fight due to a broken glass. The Reaction of the pub team to this guys where okay and deescalating.
reviews.title: nice bar with tap beer

reviews.text:
this is a place, whereas you get alkohol.. why? Because it is a kind a hotel bar although this point you notice afterwarda (for example while looking for WC)..
It should be noted that other places allow you to bring wine, bear.. but firstly you have to buy it at Drinks places.. quiet interesting approach how the forbid is overcome 
I liked this place because of location, second floor terrace whereas you get the view of the whole walking area and the sea.. you will feel in the middle of the life..
1. Location/Place: It is in the middle of maim walking street. Easy to find.. Evaluation: 10 out of 10. 
2. Size: 10+ tables.
3.Food: European.. fried chicken, onion rings and etc.lce cold bear. Evaluation: 9 out of 10. Because other places are good at spoling food
4.Service: no waiters...you order at the bar.. bar was working well.. staff - local/young..additional TRAINING would be great... Evaluation: 6 out of 10.
5. Prices: Acceptable. Bear - 30local currency (~2Eur). Meals - o.k. Wines - ok. 
6. FOOD Quality: OK quality. Fresh, good ingredients. Evaluation: 9 out of 10. But not of much interest.. for sea food you should visit SHARK, ALIBABA
7. Clean or not. Clean... if you take into account what you will see arround  - this is the place whereas you find almost accepteble level of clean... Evaluation: 9 out of 10.
8. Value: 10 out of 10. 
Mainly because you are able to get everything you need:food, bear, good view and more foreigners for socializing than i other places arround.
reviews.title: The place whereas you get alkohol served..

reviews.text: Churchill’s is a perfect place to relax and have a beer after a long day of diving, shopping, and\or relaxing and having beers. It’s conveniently just above the Red Sea Relax dive centre which was always my go to scuba spot, just try avoid running into your scuba instructor when ur drinking the night before a dive 😉. It’s terrace provides a nice view of the sea and they have an above average selection of beers. Great for evening the sun set.
reviews.title: Nice place for a beer

reviews.text: We ordered the “Megaburger” which mentioned 2 beef patties with bacon/cheese etc, we assumed it would be in 1 bun for 1 person but actually 2 separate giant burgers turned up (and chips)! Ended up feeding double the amount of people, plus there were leftovers... and it was very tasty. Though it’s not directly on the water, the rooftop still has a really nice view over the bay. Also you can get Heineken on tap (if you’re willing to pay 60 Egyptian) and the usual Stella.
reviews.title: Huge portions!

name: Ramez & Paola Restaurant
rankingString: #26 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text:
This is the nicest place I had a meal and spent some time in, in Dahab.

I've been here twice, over a space of two years.

Genuine, honest, hosts and servers... the food is genuine Italian, and there is a variety to choose from. 
All this at very moderate prices. 

Superb hygiene, superb ambience, unlike many places in dahab that are utterly fake, dirty and artificial, this is a genuine seaside restaurant.

I read some of the negative reviews on the page. The Restaurant is family-owned and run, and so you are sitting in THEIR restaurant. As always in any respectable establishment service is at the management's discretion.

This is NOT a local pub.
reviews.title: Probably the best in Dahab

reviews.text:

It's not allowed !! There is nothing i can do for you !!

reviews.text: The first two times we ate here (and the only times Paola was present) were great. Wonderful, friendly atmosphere, delicious Italian food. And so, we returned a few more times, hoping to repeat the experience. But with each visit, things became worse and worse, with the only difference being Paola's absence and Ramez's (prominent) presence. During our most recent (and likely, last) visit, the other week, Ramez was drunk and so rude with customers and staff that I was left with a bad feeling for several days (specifically after seeing him give his chef the middle finger and insulting him in other obscene ways). We were there the same night as the two previous reviews and can confirm what they say. Ramez is prone to kicking you out if you drink your own bottle of water or have the audacity to sit at a table that disagrees with his business sense. The food is a lot more expensive than in other pizza/pasta places in Dahab and the quality (of the food and the service) is inconsistent at best. That said, if Paola is there alone you are likely to have a better experience. The setting is the restaurant's only saving grace.
reviews.title: Tried them more than 5 times

reviews.text: We did not even have a chance to order. Ramez the owner was very rude and screamed at us to change tables. He was screaming at the waiters all the time, and screamed at a lady on the next table for holding a half empty water bottle. We left because of his terrible attitude!
reviews.title: Terrible attitude

reviews.text:
When i came to restaurant and ask to seat sea table

So I decided to choose another best attitude, food , helpful staff that was dai pescatori that i reserved by phone in same day and went there

reviews.title: Worst service and attitude from the owner

reviews.text:
Fruit de mare  is ok
Avocado salad too, though only very small 5 shrimps were there… you can see in the photos below

They brought olive snd really bad 2 pieces of bread with my tea, unlike authentic Italian restaurants that being freshly baked bread with drops of olive oil and freshly ground pepper to start with till appetisers are prepared.

Value for money, 3rd choice… unless you can compromise with a lot of issues there and don’t have many options

name: La Baia Pizzeria
rankingString: #32 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text:
The best home made pasta in Dahab
They have lots of Italian dishes and amazing Italian pizza
Don't miss this Italian vibe in Dahab
reviews.title: Perfect quality and taste!

reviews.text:
Very nice place and pizza is unbelievable. The place has cozy atmosphere and kinda class a type.
They also have gluten free dishes
reviews.title: Don't miss this pizza

reviews.text: This is the place to get amazing pizza. It's delicious. The flour comes directly from Italy and you can taste it too! The restaurant has had a new Italian owner for 6 months. The staff is very friendly. In terms of sustainability, I would suggest not to use plastic to cover cutlery or plastic tubes. I came to this restaurant 3 times. Thank you!
reviews.title: Best Pizza in town - don‘t miss it!

reviews.text:
I've been with my family (a 10 years old daughter) in this kind and very clean place, run by an Italian manager very friendly and professional. This Restaurant is in a good central location along the promenade but yiu can enjoy also the relaxing and discrete seats inside or choosing the first tables close to the entrance.
The food is excellent, pasta is top (I warmly suggest to get ragù bolognese) and pizza is amazing...better than many others tried in Italy. 
It is worthy to go there also for the very good rate quality/price. 
Let your stomaches a little bit empty since the desserts deserve to be in your choice. 
I looking forward to go back in Dahab to sit there and enjoy it again.
reviews.title: Real Italian style cooking and excellent cooking

reviews.text: They have the best pizza in Dahab. The restaurant is cozy and quite. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
reviews.title: Mrs

reviews.text: Very fresh ingredients and a wonderful taste. The only place I eat pizza in Dahab now. Truly Italian and a quiet place to relax.
reviews.title: Best Pizza in Dahab

reviews.text: I ate here 2 nights in a row because the pasta was so nice!  A little hidden behind Fish & Friends on the main strip, so enjoy the ambience and peace and quiet and amazing pastas or try the Cleo Pizza.
reviews.title: HOMEMADE PASTA & EVERYTHING

reviews.text:
Best pizza not just in Dahab but in  Egypt!!!
If you're looking for a good meal, go visit! Really recommended, enjoy it!
reviews.title: La Baia review

reviews.text: Excellent Italian food, pizza and pasta mostly, fantastic chef and very cost hospitable staff. Really enjoyed it. Highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Real Italian food

reviews.text:
We went to this pizzeria, because we are Italian and we always look for a tasty pizza. La Baia offers different pizzas, from margherita to Siciliana. The pizza is really nice and the topping are good. If you go there order a pizza and share a Stria with rosemary, absolutely delicious. 
About the staff they are always really nice, with a great smile. The atmosphere there is really friendly, sadly it is not well promoted so it is always quite empty; but believe me it worth a visit.
reviews.title: Good pizza and nice staff

name: Planet Cafe
rankingString: #31 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text:
Rooftop was cooler at night and the view is nice. Food was ok. Meat was tough but that may be common to the area. Spicing and flavors were good. People were nice. Service is slow but we are on vacation so not concerned. 
The cat was very annoying once our food arrived and rubbed next to us and tried to get on the table even though we kept shooing it away and did not encourage it.
reviews.title: Dinner with a view and a cat

reviews.text:
This is my favourite spot in the lighthouse area to chill and swim/snorkel and eat... since we were last here a few months ago they have refurbished the roof deck with AstroTurf and it looks really good and is super comfy to chill in the sun. Also they tend to play good music here compared to the other cafes. 
I would recommend the tuna sandwich (or the sandwiches in general), for around 70 LE the portion is big and the sandwich itself was in a huge flatbread wrap full of peppers and onion and tuna mayo - really good! Comes with chips :) 
Is a great place if you want to spend the day relaxing in the sun and if you’re in and out of the water and need a good post-snorkel feed! Staff are also friendly.
reviews.title: Best lighthouse spot

reviews.text:
I was doing my training and have to stay there and I really didn’t like the way my family and I treat it 
Food and drinks is average nothing special at all compare to the prices which is not the issue 
Need to like your job and smile in CUSTOMER faces
reviews.title: Location is good but service isn’t

reviews.text:
Starting Fady the owner, Ali the planet Manager moving to the wonderful crew Allam, Amr and all others they heap you to spend the whole visit at their place..
Extraordinary hospitality, extremely welcoming and decent in addition to being extremely friendly..
They play wonderful music in the morning while you are enjoying your tan or being by the sea..
Very good menu that adequately serves the purpose with very good prices..
reviews.title: Don’t Miss this Planet

reviews.text: Nice people. Good food. Awesome view. They do everything to let you feel welcome and home. Best is the mango juice.
reviews.title: Perfect Service

reviews.text: average seafood soup, not overly tasty and portion not big enough for the price but never seems to be in most places these days
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.text:
Had a chicken sandwich and a coffee. Took 20min for the drink to arrive. Took a further 30min for the food.
Sandwich was very disappointing- warm bland chicken in a semi-stale wrap with a bit of lettuce and mayo inside.
I did hear the chef is great here so maybe he had a day off
reviews.title: Below par

reviews.text: it is 1st raw on sea .. with a super view . we had breakfast there .. they had free wifii .. kids liked this . food was average.. they had variety of options for breakfast . service is freindly.
reviews.title: super view

reviews.text:
Nice place to spend the day . The water entrance is easy to walk with less stones. 
The staff are super friendly. 
Just a nice place to spend time. 
Considered affordable.
reviews.title: Chill place

reviews.text: Perfect location as you can spend sometime in the beach with not alot of stones, Friendly, best food in Dahab, price to service is right.
reviews.title: Perfect

name: Food Urge
rankingString: #28 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: Very tasty Egyptian breakfast, super cosy setting and friendly service! Would recomment this place for sure, will come again
reviews.title: Very nice setting

reviews.text: 4th trip for me to Dive Urge and Food Urge. Couldn't wait for thier egg wrap.. Great service with a smile
reviews.title: Still the greatest place to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: Recently tried the parmesan chicken and it was delicious. We live in Dahab and have been many times to have a toasted sandwich or wrap for lunch. The parmesan chicken was something special. The banana milkshakes are also great, so good I even started craving them!! We will be back soon. Thank you x
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, lovely food

reviews.text: I have another place to call home! I couldn't have gotten my open water certification at a better place. The lovely owner Lynn and her daughter Nadia helped me overcome my fears of the water. I'm incredibly grateful for my instructor for being so patient with me. His passion for diving showed through his teaching. Overall experience was wondering. Beautiful environment, staff, and great food!! Looking forward to making the Dive Urge a traditional vacation spot. I made friends for a lifetime!! 💙💙
reviews.title: Diving Vacation!

reviews.text:
The menu is great don’t get me wrong but where food urge really excels is when you go off menu. Talk to the chef. Find out what is fresh, what is good and what he would eat and order a large meal from that.
It was a joy each breakfast to chat with the chef knowing that something true special would appear that evening after an amazing days diving (check out Dive Urge too!) but never knowing quite what it would be. The ingredients were always local fresh and delicious, lovingly prepared and served in a chilled beach environment where the meal seemed to last forever.
Enjoy enjoy enjoy it is amazing.
reviews.title: Abandon the menu

reviews.text: One of the best places in Dahab. The food is scrumptious. I for one had a fair share of their omelettes and pancakes and they were exceptional. The staff are also super friendly. They made me feel like home. I've got nothing but compliments for them.
reviews.title: Food

reviews.text:
Food: This is one of the few places in my substantial travels to which I will always look forward to returning. While the menu could be considered somewhat limited by more robust standards, the amount of love and care that is put into every dish these guys make is not only clearly apparent, but memorable. Additionally, they are always happy to create a requested dish or come up with something off the menu in order to better accommodate their patrons.

Location: The view of the ocean and the ambient breeze that seems to be almost ever-present is second to none. You have the option of sitting in a sealed glass rotunda on the beach side or sitting on couches/cushions around the resort.

Business: the family that own the business have become like family too. It is a rarity to observe and experience so much love in one place by a wonderful family and family environment, which makes this place near and dear to me and same love is observable in every part of the business. Most, who has the opportunity to at least visit the restaurant a few times or stay at the resort a for a fews days, will come back as soon as they can.
reviews.title: Amazing place!

owner_response.text:
Hi Jonathan,
Thank you for taking the time to review Food Urge for us and i agree we are blessed with an amazing view, possibly the best in Dahab... ;)
I have passed on your comments to our Chef Attwa and Nesimi and yes you and Leah have become part of the Dive Urge family for sure :) 
Hope to see you back here for a longer visit soon.
Best fishes,
Nadia
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
The restaurant sits ocean front and offers a wide variety of comfortable seating choices. The view is excellent!!

The service was very friendly and professional. 

I ate breakfast here three times. All three times, I ordered something different and each very good. I found the ingredients to be very fresh and the presentation was attractive. The portions were also on the healthier side!

A great way to start the day.
reviews.title: Excellent breakfast 😘

owner_response.text:
Hi Michael 

We're very happy to hear you enjoyed the great location of our restaurant and hope you'll be back for more 
delicious fresh food by the sea :)

Best fishes,

Lynne
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: Excellent food cooked in spotlessly clean kitchens and delivered with a smile. The chef at dive urge is happy to create any meal you desire. For example, I’m not a big meat eater, but he created the most delicious veggie curry, and veggie kebabs that weren’t on the menu!
reviews.title: Simply the best

owner_response.text:
Thank you Julie for your lovely review :)
We do pride ourselves on providing clean and tasty food and it is good to know you enjoyed it.
We hope we see you again soon.
Best fishes,
Nadia
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: Flavourless foul, stale bread, possibly the only place in Egypt to serve mint tea without fresh mint. The view was lovely though, and the waiter was nice. Perhaps we caught them on a bad day.
reviews.title: Yesterday's lunch served for breakfast.

name: The Caves
rankingString: #29 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: Perfect place for spending a whole day with your friends directly by the ocean, And having a delicious slow cooking meal 🥘
reviews.title: Caves

reviews.text:
Didn't get to eat here but the diving was super.
I will say that the owners of the restaurant  keep the place very clean . There wasn't any trash laying about. And it was quiet with no quad bikes roaring by. No one was standing on the coral just talking. A real gem of a place to visit.
reviews.title: Great dive site

reviews.text: Today was my second day here. The food is out of the world, just WOW! Big portions as well for a very good price. Also the restaurant is very clean and has access to the sea. You can walk around next to the mountains for beautiful views. I seriously cannot recommend this restaurant enough.
reviews.title: The best food in Dahab!

reviews.text: The Caves is my favorite little getaway for a day around Dahab. The location can be easily reached by taxi and yet it's completely private, away from the regular tourism spots. One of the few authentic places left, if you're lucky you might even get to listen or join an Egyptian jam session as the owners Dad loves playing Oud. The slow-cooked food is absolutely outstanding even for vegetarians like me - no matter whether you're a meat lover or vegan, you'll leave more than satisfied. Finally some different and home-cooked food options than in all the other restaurants. Clean bathrooms as well, which is rare here! And obviously it's an amazing spot for snorkeling and diving!
reviews.title: Best authentic chillout place and food away from the hustle and mainstream tourism

reviews.text:
We had slow cooked food made with love at the caves. Products are local or from own production. 
Staff are really Nice and Do everything to make you feel comftable.

The location has amazing 'schnoorkling' and diving but needs to be arrenged before.
 
We had slowcooked lam, slowcooked veggie and redsea fish.
Some of the top meals we had in EGYPT. 
Higly recommended
reviews.title: Amazing place

owner_response.text: Thank you 🙏looking forward to your next visit 😁
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: Visiting The Caves is always a real treat, such a lovely location at the "end of the road" (for cars), nestled between the mountains and the sea, away from the masses of tourists. The food is delicious and the staff super-friendly and welcoming. Thanks to Eslam and the team!
reviews.title: Great escape from Dahab with delicious food and excellent service

owner_response.text: Thank you so much Marcus 🙏looking forward to welcome you at our place some time soon 😊

reviews.text: The beautiful caves are located south of Dahab and are perfect for a full day at the sea - scuba diving, snorkeling, chilling in the lounge, having amazing fresh food - everything is possible, just make a reservation! The scuba diving is breathtaking and full of live and there are two caves u can visit. The atmosphere is unique and the food fantastic. I will return over and over again to this magical place! Thank you for having us!
reviews.title: A perfect day at the Caves Dahab!

reviews.text: Food was amazing and service was professional and amazing atmosphere. Definitely recommend and will be back again.
reviews.title: Amazing service and food

reviews.text: Delicious fresh and authentic Lebanese food and mood. Beautiful rooftop location. Just wonderful if you like healthy tasteful food.
reviews.title: Hidden pearl

reviews.text: During our one week visit we ate here twice. The food was just amazing, the service was great and the location beautiful. Their Chicken Tawook was the best we ever ate.
reviews.title: Must visit when in Dahab

reviews.text: Great food, great views and really friendly staff.  I really enjoyed the vibe there and food was more than enough for a single person. I ordered a Beirut platter with 5 starters and it was enough for 2 people. Lovely.
reviews.title: Great food ... Great staff....Great vibe

reviews.text: My impression is that the Lebanese kitchen is something special, in the best sense of the word, yet Sabah w Masa has a touch that cast spells of a kind that money can't buy. Food made with love makes happiness. We wanted the charming waiter to give the chef our regard. The warmhearted chef came to our table confirming our sense of connection between genuine enthusiasm and outstanding food. It is unfathomable that this gourmet standard restaurant competes with its neighbours on price. This restaurant is in another league. The strangest thing is that it wasn't crowded. Sitting on this rooftop along the beach-promenade gave us a high class experience, yet a humble and generous athmosphere, freed of any sense of arrogance. We will most definitively come back and will advice others to go there.
reviews.title: In a league of its own

reviews.text:
My favorite restaurant in all Dahab. Delicious, tasty, authentic Lebanese cuisine.
Sea view, overlooking Dahab bay
Outdoor, second floor and Cousy.
Owner is decent and welcoming.
Staff is professional 
Service is great.
Prices are very reasonable.
reviews.title: Experience you don’t want you o miss

reviews.text: Great food, Lebanese food stopped for a while but now they have a great Lebanese chef who provides great service
reviews.title: Great Lebanese food

reviews.text: The best Lebanese restaurant! Very tasty food starting with the chicken liver “which i believe it’s their signature dish” to the chicken with rice and fatoush. Very friendly and polite staff. Definitely will be my spot to go to. Specially that you enjoy the best seaview while having the best most tasty dishes ever.
reviews.title: Best Lebanese restaurant in Dahab

reviews.text:
Great restaurant with a panoramic view of the sea, the food tasted great! I went there many times and tried a lot of appetizers, salads and dishes.
Starting from appetizers ( chicken liver, baba ghanouj, hummus and fatayer) to the salads ( fattoush, tabouleh and grilled sabah w masa salad) to the delicious hot dishes ( rice with chicken, Grilled kibbeh, tawook, chicken lemon, chicken piccata and chicken curry) 
Excellent quality and service. I really recommend coming in the evening while the sun is setting!
reviews.title: Great Restaurant

reviews.text:
- The best lebanese cuisine not only in Dahab but in Egypt. 

- The stuff is so friendly and you will alwyas feel that you are around your family.

- Must try (Liver with pomegranate molasses, Grilles Kebbah, Susage, Taboula and Fatous)

- Food quality and quantity are awesome. 

- Great view on the light house bay.

- Must try in Dahab
reviews.title: Perfect dinner 🍽

name: Koushary
rankingString: #98 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text:
It’s cheap, hearty and packed with flavour. I like extra crispy onions and chilli sauce on mine.

It’s cheap too and will fill you up!
reviews.title: Can’t beat a cheap n cheerful hearty carb filled kosh!

reviews.text: This was my first time in Egypt, but I had koshary before and really liked it. I was excited to come to Egypt to taste the koshary there but was disappointed when most people told me that there is no koshary in dahab. One man then told me about this restaurant and it was the same street as my hotel so I went to try it. All I can say it is okay, but the sauces were not tasteful as they should be and were on the watery side which made my koshary wet when I put them on. This is the only restaurant that sells koshary, so I would advise them to hire someone who makes good koshary and the restaurant will have a lot of visitors instead of being relatively empty.
reviews.title: The only koshary

reviews.text:
Good for low budget and local food.
The service is very fast and nice.
When we arrived they gave us a free glass of water for every person and when we finish it they refill it.
reviews.title: Good local food

reviews.text:
I visited the restaurant after I got a recommendation from a local person I met in dive shop because I just arrived in Dahab and I didn't know where to go for late lunch. It was a small restaurant and I found it difficult choosing menu - only 1 page but I didn't understand. I asked a meduim-sized dish and it consisted of rice, noodle, macaroni, lentil and tomato sauce etc. It really looks like a kind of snack for me but I felt fool when I had it. It was better when I put some spicy sauce.
It cost only 7 LE but tastes really nice and proper for a simple meal I think.
reviews.title: very nice for a simple meal

reviews.text: we pop in for a kosheri from time to time at lunch time to fill up on a well balanced pot of what can be described as a fresh healthy pot noodle with lentils, chick peas etc... Its totally vegetarian but I'm sold, for 50 pence you will not need to eat till late in the evening as kosheri is very filling!
reviews.title: cheap and filling, healthiest fast food in dahab

name: Downtown Cafe
rankingString: #97 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: Ordered 2 juices, had to wait for 35 min to get them, the wrong ones… then had to wait 25min more to get only one… asked for ice cubes, after 30min we didn’t get them, so we just paid for 1. Asked for the bill , even that took time…they found it normal, even though we were almost e the only 2 people there 🙈
reviews.title: Looooong!

reviews.text: Great view. Cozy seating and friendly staff. Waiters might be a bit slow with service, but who cares when you're seated on the red sea? Place might be empty but that's a plus for me. Visiting there again on my next trip.
reviews.title: View

reviews.text:
The place location is very good 
About drinks and food is good as well and the stuff is super nice and friendly
reviews.title: Nice friendly stuff

reviews.text: Just stopped in for a quick lunch and the view was what sold us on this restaurant.  Great for pictures over the water
reviews.title: Gotta try the swings

reviews.text: Excellent site and view, very simple but services are bad due to not good waiters that make me not visit again as they have poor behaviour, very delayed service, errors in receipt calculation
reviews.title: Very good view but bad services

reviews.text: A very amazing view especially when you will play with the swings in front of the sea, affordable prices
reviews.title: Amazing view

reviews.text: Beautiful decorations, that’s it. A lot of items from their menu don’t exist, they try to cheat you in your bills so be sure you check total before you pay. They write prices way higher than menu and it’s the only place in dahab that charges for service (without previous mention). Worst experience ever
reviews.title: Cheaters

reviews.text:
We, four people, the only guests at all at that time. Before entering we ensured beer is no problem and can be arranged.

Okay, so we ordered two beers and two mango shakes. After 15 minutes the shakes arrived and we were told the beers would follow. After another twenty minutes we left without beers and had to pay 100 pounds for the two shakes and a bottle of water. 

We decided for another location - Jasmine, ordered while entering and before we even found seats on the upper deck, drinks arrived.
reviews.title: Nice location but worst service ever

reviews.text: This cafe is so different from all the other cafes in dahab and the decor is amazing - so artistic! There are swings, a hanging seat, a rooftop area with fabulous views and lots of comfortable seating where you can while away the days and nights with cool drinks or very good coffee. I would really recommend a visit.
reviews.title: Dreamy Downtown

reviews.text: Good drinks, good prices and friendly staff, the music they play is very very good also and the swings are really fun :D
reviews.title: Cozy place

name: Popeye Sandwich
rankingString: #96 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: I ordered 'eskandarani sausages' served with onions and tomatoes on grill, also i ordered 'eskandrani liver ' it was not as good as we eat at cairo and there's no 'tehina' but it's taste was good and finally the classic beef burger sandwich was nice, the highlight of the experience that was the friendly staff simple place and affordable prices comparing to the sea frond restaurants. Overall ranking 7/10
reviews.title: Nice oriental taste , delicious and affordable prices

reviews.text: For the low budget visitors or for those who intend to stay for a long period and want economic solution for lunch and/or supper, I strongly recommend this resturant, it's not fancy place but I garantee you will like the taste, fill your tank and save your pocket, besides being in the middle of the live walking area of dahab
reviews.title: Perfect for the price

reviews.text:
The food is good, fresh,  quantity quality and with good prices 
The burger was good
The best thing was the "sogok"
reviews.title: Awesome food

reviews.text:
So based on all the positive reviews I tried it out, ordered the fajita chicken sandwich and to be honest it wasn't to my liking... I think watching the guy make it might have had a fair bit to do with it... I know when you come to Dahab we have to expect slightly lower hygiene conditions but this place was a clear health hazard in the making... Let me explain, the guy pulled out raw chicken from under the counter (I'm praying from a fridge!) then proceeded to chop up what looked like little pieces of gristle... He threw it all in to a hot plate to cook and without washing his hands from the raw chicken decided to handle the bread roll! 

As for the seating, if you like eating in a dirty street surrounded by pick up trucks then go for it!

I tried the chicken fajita filling and it was tasteless , the whole thing went in the bin!!

I will not be returning...
reviews.title: Just be careful...

reviews.text:
Cheapest restaurant in dahab still the most delicious.... Try out their fajita you'll get the craziest most delicious flavor... And also a very cheap restaurant... You'll get the peak of hospitality there you'll try your self 😋  

Самый дешевый ресторан в Дахабе еще самый вкусный .... Попробуйте их Фахита вы получите сумасшедший самый вкусный аромат ... А также очень дешевый ресторан ... Вы получите максимум гостеприимства там вы попробуйте Ваш сам 😋
reviews.title: Cheapest restaurant in dahab still the most delicious

photos.caption: Cheapest restaurant in dahab still the most delicious

reviews.text: We had a long evening/ night ahead of us and hate airport food, so asked for a chicken sandwich to take away. So glad we did! It was really tasty, full of flavour,in a tightly rolled wrap, very easy to eat, and so much nicer than easy jet sandwich! We didn't have a chance to sit down here to eat, but the young man who runs it is so friendly and very proud of his food. Highly recommend this little place.
reviews.title: Good to go for airport

reviews.text: Great food., fabulous snack/ sandwich bar with one or tables outside. great choice and all cooked fresh with ingredients from the local shops, the owner is a young guy and so friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend
reviews.title: Great food

reviews.text: We have eaten here 3 times on this visit to Dahab x the guy is very friendly and attentive x the food is all cooked fresh x very nice x and you can sit in POPEYE SQUARE ( as we call it !! ) and watch the random going ones !! X x Sue & Darren xx
reviews.title: Lovely food

reviews.text: Решили как-то разнообразить свое меню и съесть шаурму в "Папае". Ну что могу сказать - в Москве за те же деньги намного больше и вкуснее шаурма. А здесь это просто булка с несколькими кусочками курицы и овощей. Есть можно, но не более того. Зато здесь, говорят, единственное место в городе, где можно днем в Рамадан курицы поесть.
reviews.title: Шаурма на "троечку"

reviews.text:
Sehr kleine, von außen nicht vertrauensbildende Sandwichbude direkt am Lighthouse die es in sich hat.

Der Besitzer ist sehr nett und zuvorkommend und besorgt alle Zutaten frisch in den umliegenden Geschäften, dem Essen kann man also problemlos vertrauen, und schmecken tut es auch noch, und das ganze für kleines Geld. 
Der perfekte Platz für den schnellen Snack zwischendurch.
reviews.title: Mitten drin statt nur dabei!

name: Blue Beach Restaurant
rankingString: #37 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text:
We ate there all through December2021
Loved the menus, loved the food, value great, great chef! 
Great service Mohamed and Kasia....Thankyou.
reviews.title: Fantastic food

reviews.text: For some months now, what used to be the full service restaurant at the Blue Beach Club has become a bar called The Lounge featuring a full range of cocktails and music to dance to from a dj several nights a week. Guests staying at the hotel still get breakfast served here, but the space is taken over by the Lounge at noon so service ends at 10.30 when cleaning takes over and, with the kitchen 'closed', people come in and smoke--the smell never leaves the place. The old wooden tables with linen table cloths and the chairs with cushions have been replaced by minimalist steel and pressed board seats and tables. Most of the plants have been removed.
reviews.title: No longer a restaurant but a bar

reviews.text:
I had a steak with blue cheese sauce. 
Medium rare cook was nicely served and I had satisfied on my dinner.

reviews.text: Went to this restaurant several times over some years and liked it. Apparently, there was a change in the kitchen and this time, the food was disappointing. Can't recommend it at the moment

reviews.text:
We have vistited the Blue Beach Restaurant for our dinner frequently and we really liked the taste of the food offered. Especially I loved the Chicken fingers with french fries with the amazing sauce!!!
You can order inside the restaurant and even enjoy your dinner sitting on the beachside outside and watching the sunset. It is truely breathtaking and the food is awesome!
I loved it and we will definitely be back!

reviews.text: They have  a big restaurant inside but the best place is out by the sea....I know if a want a good steak always I come to the Blue Beach because the steak si good!!! reviews.text: If I have the urge to have a steak there is for me only one place in Dahab at the moment and that is Blue Beach restaurant. Service is good, not exceptional but the steaks make up for it for me.

Great food and view with speedy service.
Only drawback we’re the stairs which were a bit problematic with our baby stroller , would also be great to have a baby chair

reviews.text:
Oh my word this place is incredible, I can’t fault it. It’s hidden away above a diving centre in Dahab, and the rooftop views are stunning. Super friendly staff, great coffee and the food was to die for. Our biggest regret of our trip is not going more! 

Thank you Tamin and the team for a breakfast we won’t forget 🥰👍
reviews.title: PHENOMENAL

reviews.text: I am writing this review to share my exceptional breakfast experience in Tim's munch. I went there with my friends in October 2022 for breakfast. Tim's munch is a family based restaurant. It's Tim, his mother and sister, the 3 are extremely welcoming the guests and extremely amiable. As for the food it was extremely tasty, i didnt taste this taste even in the fanciest and overpriced restaurants in Cairo. The taste of the food remebered me of Paris pastries for real. The food is so tasty, very well coooked and presented and the portions are so big and u cannot complete a whole plate. As for the price it is so resonable and competitive and so cheap compared to the very good quality offered. Thanks Tim's munch for this memorable breakfast.
reviews.title: My experience with the tasty breakfast in Tim's munch during my stay in October 2022

reviews.text: Literally from the best breakfasts i had in Dahab! Their presentation is great too and it’s good value for money .. it’s also overlooking the sea from top
reviews.title: From the best breakfasts I had in dahab!

reviews.text:
The restaurant is very friendly and I had classic breakfast and it was amusing specially the pancakes and bacon

reviews.text:
I ate in lots of Indian restaurants in my life (France, UK, middle East ok,never in India but anyway...) and this one is the poorest I tried.
Almost tasteless massala chai
raïta made with industrial VERY SWEET yogurt
EXTREMLY SALTY sauce for chicken tikka masala
OVERCOOKED basmati rice. Not easy to spoil rice but they managed to do it, congratulations !
Cheese Naan without cheese ("but that's the way we do it" as I was answered...)
And completely overpriced (almost 600 egyptian livres).
Farewell "Nirvana" ! 🤣
reviews.title: No way

reviews.text:
I would like to say that this Indian restaurant is as good as any Indian restaurant in India. Proper Indian food, made by an Indian Chef with Indian ingredients.

I can recommend the chicken masala and the chicken penne roll.

reviews.text: We came as a group of four to eat dinner, some of us have been to India, and some never tasted Indian food- we all enjoyed the food tremendously and wanted to go back. we ordered two chicken dishes and two vegetarian dishes- all were delicious.

reviews.text:

reviews.text: Don’t let the no frills, low key look of Nirvana fool you, this place packs a punch when it comes to flavour. I have been eating here for years now, whenever I’m in town, and it remains a firm favourite. They happily bag leftovers up for you when you over order, which I always do because everything tastes so damn good. Do yourself a favour and give Nirvana a try if you haven’t already. Don’t miss out on eating a samosa or two dipped in the best mint sauce ever! Can also recommend the paneer, the tikka masala and veggie korma to name just a few dishes worth sampling.
reviews.title: A Firm Favourite

reviews.text:
Not many places can you sit with the sea at your feet and help yourself to a fabulous Indian buffet dinner. 
Tandoori chicken was succulent, as were the vegetarian options.
reviews.title: Excellent buffet

reviews.text:
I spent two weeks in Dahab and ate here most nights, love the vibe and the quality of the food! 

Even took friends along who all were just as addicted!

The vegetarian options were just as good as the meat and the purées were phenomenal!
reviews.title: Best Indian Food in Dahab!

reviews.text: I got a vegan lunch that's not on the menu and it was pretty nice, and chilled with some tea and a fruit salad on the rooftop in the evening. The view is great and the staff is very sweet, hospitable and a lot of fun. Cheers, Samouil!
reviews.title: They make you feel like home!

reviews.text:
We came with our tour guide, we were offered rice, soup, 2 salads each. We shared a plate of oyster, fish, calmari and shrimps.
He brought us the fish without weighing it in front of us. We also agreed that the calamari, shrimps, oyster should be 1/2 a kilo.
The fish we got is different than the one we chose in terms of size, and the calmari, shrimps and oyster is much less than the expected.
We ended up paying 2000 LE and this is too much with respect to the food eaten as well as the quality itself.
When we talked with the manager, he said he can deduct 85 off the total, but this is nothing for us..we expected to pay 1200 maximum but not that much.
I don’t recommend it at all.
reviews.title: If there is something less than terrible i would go for it

reviews.text: The food was good and the service was impeccable. The view and the feel of the restaurant gives a nice feeling.
reviews.title: A true Egyptian feel

reviews.text: Very tasty and varied food, I ate well done sea fish, additions like hot salad pita and good flavored potatoes. Fast and pleasant service and very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Beautiful restaurant close to beautiful beach

name: Xat Delights
rankingString: #104 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text:
Xat Delights left me with the best impression through several varieties of offered dishes , either you eat normal , eat healthy , vegetarian or vegan , you will definitely enjoy your choice. Everything is freshly made and well presented , the atmosphere is very welcoming , it is simply a cozy little spot whether you want enjoy time with friends and family or you want to have your solo time. 
My daughter enjoyed a lot her birthday party with her friends , the place was well decorated , the birthday carrot cake was yummy and the girls enjoyed their lovely burger buns.
If you go to Dahab , You MUST go there :)
reviews.title: Excellent food quality , Friendly cozy atmosphere

name: Dai Pescatori
rankingString: #36 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: We’ve eaten at Dai Pescatori four times during several visits to Dahab and were very satisfied each time. This time, on our first evening in Dahab, we had very nice pizzas at one of the beach tables. A few nights later, we went back for pasta which was equally good. I’ve seen several reviews about the staff being rude, but that has not been our experience during three visits to Dahab. Of course, it was low season, so there was no stress.
reviews.title: A regular stop when we visit Dahab

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing atmosphere, very nice clientele, food is just delicious,  plus a very friendly service. All the experience was lovely, from the moment we stepped in , the mood on the sea side, the welcoming and the food taste, all was just amazing.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing experience

reviews.text:
I can't believe service can be so horrible. No hello, no thank-you, not even a smile. It looks like you are not welcome at all... I don't talk about food because you cannot call it restaurant with that kind of behaviour...sad 
We order wine from the number they give you to do it... the wine wasn't good anymore.. not they fault, not mine.. I just told them its not good anymore and they said its my fault because I did open it ...

reviews.text: Great food, especially the fish dishes. The service was very kind and surprisingly efficient in Sinai standards.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Very nice Italian restaurant. It's a bit more expensive but totally worth it! They make the pasta fresh themselves. And although it's not on a the menu, ask if they have burrata!
reviews.title: Homemade pasta!

reviews.text: I’ve eaten here several times over the last year now so I feel like I can make a good general comment. The atmosphere is very good for families as well as couple nights. The food ranges from good to very good. Personally I would say the appetisers/salads are brilliantly done but the pastas require some perfecting. So we usually have an Italian ‘tapas instead rather than a main. Staff are lovely and attentive. I’ve seen but not interacted with the owner so I cannot comment on him (as per recent comments). Either way, staff have been attentive and are always able to sit us down even if we forgot to book. Always a top 3 in Dahab!
reviews.title: Great place, would recommend

reviews.text: Overpriced , I tried but will not do again as the quality is normal and will not  be surprised however pizza or pasta both are under normal food categories
reviews.title: Do wast ur money

reviews.text: The owner was very hostile he absolutely ruined our evening and made us feel very uncomfortable. He also wanted us to leave as soon as possible to let the table free for a new group. We had the table until 7:30 but he told us to move at 7:20 although we had ordered the check and he took very long to bring it. Once we paid, we had to stand up to wait for the change which was taking very long. The food was terrible and now we have indigestion. I don’t understand how this place has good ratings.
reviews.title: Very hostile

reviews.text: Just don’t come here.  The food is average at best. The owner is appaling and managed to ruin the evening.  Just don’t come here.

reviews.text: The owner is very aggressive and offensive in an impressive way. We went in nicely, then when he noticed that some of our group were veiled, he asked for a reservation. We told him we dont have but we can wait for sometime. Then he told us then you can come back in more than two hours. Our reply was that he is just telling us go away nicely. Suddenly he became mad and started screaming and shouting tell us that this is disrespectful, I am the owner, and you cannot speak to me this way. He did not stop his madness and screaming until we left him alone for good...
reviews.title:
Bad Experience 
Racism

The owner is impolite and very rude, when I put my review on FaceBook, I received very disrespectful reply. Check attached screenshots for his reply.
Restaurant is closed most of the time under the delusion of not finding fresh components, I wonder how other good restaurants in Dahab open everyday on time!! I consider it simply a handsome camouflage for laziness. Quality of burger is really normal, I swear my wife do it better at home. The menu is not updated, many items don't exist and unchecked in black marker by the owner, in addition those having green arrow beside. It was a bad experience I will never repeat.

Laziz owns a small restaurant just araound the lighthouse corner,

reviews.text: the burger was good the value was great the only thing made me made is the opening time and the owner delay to open as i were infront of it from 4Pm ( time to open ) to 4:35PM and he didn came .
reviews.title: good burger

reviews.text: This place has such a nice vibe. And it’s great that the owner is passing on such a warm and sweet work ethic to his sons. He buys Fresh what he expects he needs for each day; then closes when he runs out. His burgers are a testament of love, truly, for his business, his love of food, and his family. His prices are good, too. Also, the Drink with Me shop is next door, so that’s cool 😎. Enjoy! Oh, no fries though - but you can order a basket from KarKour, cheap and fresh.
reviews.title: So nice!

reviews.text:
The place is very brightly painted, cosy, Khaled the owner is a SUPER friendly person with a welcoming smile always.
The burger is the best I have ever tasted in my life no kidding. Fresh, clean, juicy & very meticulously prepared. The bread is a special one.
His ingredients are always fresh so he finishes relatively early & you r lucky if you could catch him before he runs out coz once he is out of ingredients, he closes even if before his normal closing hour (10 pm) which is relatively early here in Dahab!
So if you r in for some juicy homemade clean burger, hit it FIRST right after the beach (after 4 pm) then go shower & enjoy the rest of the night!
reviews.title: The best burger in Dahab

name: Jackie's
rankingString: #41 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: HORRIBLE PLACE. They’re all scammers there. They have a salsa night there. They don’t tell you it’s 75 pounds, until after and make you pay. We told them it wasn’t told to us that you have to pay from before and therefore we didn’t pay. Once the bill came, we found out they added 200 pounds on our bill for things we didn’t order. They told us we ordered beer when we didn’t drink any alcohol loll. They added a guacamole charge on our nachos when we didn’t order it with our nachos, AND it didn’t even come with the guacamole😂😂. The salsa instructor is very aggressive and was screaming out things to his friends in whatever language he was speaking (most likely cussing out the people he was teaching because none of us knew salsa and he seemed so angry). All the employees there including the owner seemed to be high😂, they were talking very slowly, and all their points were idiotic. We ended up paying for the food that we actually got, but the whole bill thing was 2 full hours wasted. Terrible terrible place, I strongly recommend not going unless you want to get scammed.
reviews.title: Scammers.

reviews.text:
We were really excited to try this restaurant given we love Mexican and it’s quite famous in Dahab but unfortunately we were greatly disappointed.

1- Service: the waiter was quiet uneducated in anything to do with menu, he had to go ask about very basic items and finally explained the food in a very unappetizing way. To be fair he was polite and eager to please when needed.

2- Food: missing ALOT of spices that actually is the essence of Mexican food. Ordered the guacamole it came as chopped Avos and vegetables not the regular creamy. The waiter just said this is how the chef does it although in other pictures from the restaurant this is not true. Tacos were bland and very disappointing in presentation.

3- Atmosphere: other than the poor lighting it’s actually the most positive thing about the place. It’s right in front of the sea so you get a pretty nice view if you catch a sea view table.
reviews.title: Over rated non Mexican food

reviews.text: Poor food and service. Tacos were more beans than chicken. Very loud music and I had to ask for my change. Not recommended
reviews.title: Not nice

reviews.text: We were a party of 7 people including children. Saw great options on the menu, and salsa night sounded like fun. Ordered monitor and beer and some starters. Nachos were stone cold and just covered in gooey 'cheese', not a queso at all. Mojitos were pink, had no alcohol at all and tasted like toothpaste. They added some alcohol but they were still awful. Kids meals arrived and the taquitos and chicken fingers were good. Adult mains (2 kinds of chicken enchiladas and chicken tacos) were just awful and took over an hour to arrive. Dry, bland despite being beautifully presented. We couldn't even finish half, just left the whole thing on the plate and none of the staff cared. Chicken fajitas were fairly good, pico de gallo was fresh. The kids ordered churos for desert which arrived burnt into little sticks and smothered in gobs of dry cinnamon. Have had much, much better mexican style food elsewhere in Egypt. Aside from the meal being a total disappointment, the salsa lessons were just some foreigner shouting at the couples who were participating. For the high prices we paid, we left hungry and very disappointed. There are far better options on the boardwalk.
reviews.title: Such a disappointment

reviews.text:
The place is nicely located, but noisy, and food needs a lot of improvement: food was served cold on a few occasions, and orders where mixed, ice-cream was liquid. 
It was Thursday and they had a salsa class with a loud instructor and obviously loud music, ideal for couples who would want to learn, but not suitable for a quite dinner if that’s what you’re after. 
The place has a couple of local dogs, servers would play with the dogs while back and forth, which is not hygienic if they serve food and put cutlery on tables. Other basic food hygiene principles were not followed.
reviews.title: Mediocre food, loud entertainment.

reviews.text: They have steps that take you to the water, where you can have a nice dip then chill on the lounge chairs. Great food, drinks and music. The staff is absolutely amazing. They also have a beautiful vibe at night.
reviews.title: Beautiful place right on the sea!

reviews.text:
The worst Mexican food you will ever eat! I don’t even know how they call this ‘food’. When I even complained about the quality of the food, they weren’t even bothered to do anything about it. 

Poor in everything.
reviews.title: The Worst in Dahab!

reviews.text:
I love the location, the food and the staff. Everyone is so friendly and the food is absolutely delicious. I tried the veggie tacos and the vegetarian enchiladas and they both were AMAZING. 
The salsa night was also a lot of fun.
reviews.title: Fun, beautiful location, delicious food, friendly staff

reviews.text: Excellent vegan options! It was so delicious. We had the guacamole, veggie tacos and veggie fajitas.
reviews.title: Excellent vegan options!

reviews.text: The restaurant is direct on the shore, the view to the sea and the downtown in the evening is awesome. We had a very tasty food (on the photo). Mr. Ahmed the restaurant manager plus the team doing really great, very attentive and polite. Drinks are tasty as well. Dont miss this place - u will love it. *come as a guest - leave as a friend :)

name: Coffee Wheel

name: Green Valley

reviews.text: Seeing some reviews talking about bad service I can only imagine that they changed the staff recently because one of the nicest people we met in Dahab was this waiter at Green Valley. We walked in the first day in town still a bit lost not knowing where to go or what to eat and this guy was so nice and friendly that we stayed. We ordered hummus, molokia soup and Veggie mossaka. Everything was delicious. Warm pita bread, seemed like fresh made, probably the best hummus we had in almost a month now in Egypt and the mossaka was not what we expected but was delicious. We rarely repeat restaurants specially on a place with so many options but here we went back for the great food and extremely friendly service.

reviews.text:
I tried to post this review months ago, but because we were the first customers, I couldn't add the location. So, I'm glad to see it's finally on here because it's worth the good publicity. Here is my original review:

As their first-ever customers, my husband and I feel compelled to review (Where You Wanna Go?) I Don't Care, not out of a sense of obligation but because this place deserves to do well and should be shared amongst the TripAdvisor community. We ate here on our last two nights in Dahab, and we enjoyed every minute of it. 

From the street view, it looks a little expensive because of it's unique, modern decor: the seating is made up of comfortable sofas with warm lighting, and it is impeccably clean. Once you have a look at their menu, though, you'll discover their pricing is fair and comparable to its neighbours.

And it's well worth it because their food is excellent and unlike any other restaurant we tried. The first night we shared their warm, handmade bread, fresh juice, tasty Greek salad, steak grilled to perfection and handmade pasta. We were fully sated and satisfied. On our last night in Dahab, we sampled their salami pizza (baked in a proper Italian oven!) and deliciously fragrant beef tagine. Perfect! The portions were too large for us to attempt dessert, but the Italian-trained chef assured us they're scrumptious. We wish we had had one more day to try his lasagne. 

The restaurant does not serve alcohol, but they will gladly go to the shop to buy whatever it is you desire. We also saw other customers order shisha.

What made it for my husband and I was the attentive, friendly and timely service. In a market that's desperately vying for patrons, we felt absolutely no pressure and hassle for our custom. It was a truly pleasurable dining experience from start to finish. We wish them every success because they certainly deserve it!
reviews.title: First customers who'd love to return

reviews.text:
I have been coming to Dahab since 2003. When the winds pick up Shells is my favourite place to relax and swim. With no wind at the Light House area.
The best part about Shells is Ashraf Sultan. He is so good with guests, customers. He is welcoming, makes sure that all guests are happy. Works as a team.Ahmed also who works there is wonderful.
Upon arrival I don't even have to ask but hot Latte is being prepared for me. After my swim there is always Lemon juice.
One of the days at lunch two beautifully freshly caught fish were prepared for friends and I and they were really delicious. 
The place is kept, clean and spotless. and it has a lot of seating, long chairs with parasols from the sun.
Near by you can rent snorket gear and fins if you forgot. If after swimming you want to rinse of the salt water there is a place to take a hot shower. 
I always left my personal belongs on the chairs while I swam and felt safe. 
Great place to come on your own, or with freinds or a romantic gateaway.
If you need advise, or idea for evenings ask Sultan he will come up with something great for everyone.
Ahmed was also really great and helpful.
Check it out and enjoy a day at the beach at the Light House at Shells.
reviews.title: Great location Great Service by Sultan and Fresh Fish

reviews.text: In the more quiet end of the boardwalk. Nice and friendly staff. Food and coffee of good quality. we were there several times. One night we had their fresh fish in batter. Very nice.
reviews.title: Nice and friendly

reviews.text: This used to be a good restaurant until the time they required a minimum spend of 100£e per person. 100£e per table would have been reasonable but per person even 50£e is too much. They still have a good spot though since it is in the Lighthouse. But i think it is not worth going there anymore.  Even their coffee taste became inconsistent. The last time i ordered, i can hardly taste the coffee since there was too much milk.  Also the pizza used to taste good until the time they burned it and you cannot distinguish the difference between margherita and cheese pizza. The service became really bad. Disappointing.
reviews.title: Used to Be a Good Restaurant

reviews.text:

reviews.text:
It's rare to have a bad experience at any of the restaurants on the main Dahab promenade, but this certainly was one of them. I ordered the the coconut curry (which sounded good on their menu and was reasonably priced ) but didn't stay to taste it. The table looked dirty so I wiped it with some Kleenex which turned black with just one wipe! They brought the free hors d'oeuvres but none of them were edible and the bread was not fresh. I couldn't even eat this stuff, but in all the other restaurants here, it's usually delicious. I told them that I was not going to stay for more, as I didn't like the taste of anything so far. I apologized for leaving before my meal arrived and left, which I have never done before. When I looked to see what the name of the restaurant was, a staff member said, "You don't need to know the name of this restaurant."  When I went to write a review on Trip Advisor, I realized that my experience was not unique. I wished I had read other people 's reviews before going to this place.

The only good thing I can say about El Mundo is that when I went to wash my hands in their bathroom, at least they had soap

I went right next door to a restaurant called Forsha's and had an excellent meal, so everything ended well ....
reviews.title: Don't waste your time eating here!

reviews.text: What started out as a smiling sweet service industry ended up with food we didn't order. We are easy people, if someone messes up and order, we will take it, minor details. Life is too short. However, this place was an exception. They pushed food on us we didn't want and said that we ordered it. They brought it to us half cooked and said we had to pay almost 400 pounds for it. We left and the server was swearing at us. It was crazy. Avoid this place. It was really bad service and the food was shady as well.
reviews.title: The worst review I've ever written.

reviews.text: Tourists stay away from this place. I was talked into going there by the nice guy on the front who showed me the menu which had reasonable prices all around 90 Egyptian pounds. I ordered my food with 5 starters (included) I was then asked if I wanted one type of fish or a mixed platter I decided for the latest and also ordered a bottle of water. Food was good but the total price was 1275 Egyptian pounds, I did not even have the money with me but was made to draw out from an ATM.  I have later found out that it was an extortion, everyone from my hotel was shocked and wanted me to go to the police. PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE THERE ARE MUCH BETTER CHOICE
reviews.title: Dishonest people

reviews.text: We were taken to El Mundo in Dahab by our tour guide after a trip to St Catherines Monastery - a wonderful trip so we expected somewhere decent to eat..... We were taken into Dahab via a filthy back street, rubbish and dumped stuff everywhere - when we got to El Muno we were absolutely dismayed - the floor was filthy, the seats were covered in cat hair and food debris.. the food came eventually - some sort of bashed up chicken thick with grease with 6 chips, some 'dips', some rice -all totally inedible. One couple got up and walked away - we just didn't eat, one lady on our table was vulnerable so we didn't feel we could leave her alone there. Several battered & flea ridden cats kept jumping on the seats and tables - 2 actually jumped up and took the food off a plates and ran off with it!  I needed to use the bathroom - well, I wished I hadn't - disgusting! But worse still, the kitchen was next door and open - I actually couldn't believe that they were 'cooking' food for human consumption in there..
reviews.title: Flea ridden, filthy, inedible food - disgusting toilets and kitchen

There are so many good places to go in Dahab where the people are wonderful and the service is excellent so avoid, avoid, avoid.

reviews.text:
I have been eating at King Falafel many times because the food is delicious for a budget price.
In addition, staff is very friendly, service is quick and portions are generous.
They offer a wide range of local fast food, all of it vegetarian or vegan and very tasty.
My preferred way of eating is to order several small dishes and eat them with flat bread or ready-made falafel sandwiches for take away.
They have some of the best Moussaka and Shakshuka in Dahab, the falafel are great too!
A lot of the food is fried but if you prefer healthier options you can go for beans (with boiled egg), mashed potatoes, mixed veggies, salad or tahina.
They also have a second, larger restaurant in El Mashtaba Street with similar food.
reviews.title: Great Value For Money and Friendly

photos.caption: a homely kitchen...but soon a new kitchen

reviews.text: The Shanti Cafe was so inviting. The exterior is painted with bright happy colors and really has a beach feel. Entering you are immersed in a bohemian coffee shop vibe, the ceiling draped with beautiful live plants and a friendly pup greeting you at the door. Food was really fresh, lots of vegan and vegetarian options. Excellent flavors and great variety. We enjoyed quinoa avocado salads and fresh pressed juice for lunch and returned for dinner because everything has just smelled so good. My sister had the Pasta Bolognese and I had the seafood like rice ... both delicious and again made to order. Ended the night with a vegan chocolate honey cake, cappuccino and camomile / lemon grass tea. I enjoyed it all so much that I returned for breakfast the next day and had pancakes draped in fresh strawberries and honey. Really a wonderful place.
reviews.title: Excellent fresh, healthy food

This is not a Michelin restaurant in Paris but it is without a doubt a perfect restaurant for lunch or dinner with excellent food served beautifully and very tasty, and the price? Fair and even cheap.

reviews.text:
During a vacation in Dahab, I came across a restaurant recommendation. Since there is a restaurant of the same name on the promenade by the sea, it took me a while to find the place. The restaurant is located on EL FANAR Street five minutes walk from the promenade.
The place is butchery and restaurant. The meat is fresh, excellent and delicious.
In addition to various types of meat, Egyptian dishes are prepared there.
The serving, the flavors, the atmosphere and everything related to the place, is just wonderful!
The prices are cheap (hoping not to raise prices following the recommendations :))
In short ... If you are in Dahab, walk five minutes from the promenade to EL FANAR Street, enter the AL FANAR restaurant, let the staff recommend you what to take, and have fun :)
reviews.title: Great surprise

owner_response.text:
Dear Mziv, 

Thank you for taking the time to review us! You were our first review under our new name. 

We appreciate the efforts you made to find our location and thank you for the helpful directions. As a result of your feedback, we have marked signs to the restaurant at Lighthouse, hoping to make the location a little easier.  

From the whole staff at Grill House Restaurant, we would like to thank you. 

We look forward to welcoming you again.

Best regards, 

The Grill House Team

reviews.text: After reading really good reviews I was a little disappointed with my dinner here. The service was great, and yes the location is gorgeous, but that was the best thing about the meal. We had calamari to start, and it was really chewy. For the main course I had vegetable tajine. It was actually peas and carrots in a red sauce with melted cheese on top. I like these things, so I enjoyed it, but it was not tajine. My boyfriend had grilled chicken, which was better but nothing special. Like I said, the waiters were great and it was a beautiful location to chill out, but not the best meal we had in Dahab.

This is by far the best place to work online. Nice and quiet restaurant with good Wifi.

We were with 10 and were looking for a place to have our Christmas dinner so the owner of 3D House (where we stayed) contacted Lidia Restaurant and made a  reservation for us.

I really like to thank Youssef for taking such good care of us! You are an amazing man and from all of us the best wishes for the 2022. We hope to see you again in the summertime!
reviews.title: Amazing Christmas dinner for my group!

reviews.text:
I and my Fiance were looking for a cozy restaurant when we stumbled on this gem at the beachfront. 

It was not busy and the view was so wonderful that we decided to have dinner here. The staff took really good care of us and even chased away the cats that were coming to our table (something to get used to in Egypt). 
The food was very well prepared and tasty. 

We went back for lunch and had a look at the hotel for our next trip. Thank you Mohamed for showing us around. Hopefully see you next Summer!
reviews.title: Beautiful spot!

reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel and absolutely love this place!  Breakfast simple but definitely fulfilling and the view o0f the Red Sea made it extra tasty! .. Also had a couple of very tasty dinners at the hotel restaurant and they made a breakfast box tot take away when I had an early start.

reviews.text:
I went to the cafe on my first day in Dahab to work. I found the air-con room to be too small, with too much sun coming in. I paid 100 EGP for half a day, and that's four times of what I'd pay in a co-working space/cafe in Maadi, Cairo! I expected with 100 that I'd be getting a free drink. Well, nope! It costs 40+ EGP. All what you'll get is a couch and a table in a small crowded room on the 1st floor.
The cafe has really nothing special, and the fee to be able to have internet/cowork is just ridiculous. I rather use my 4G and enjoy a drink at other cafes nearby, which have more space and seating options.
I did not go back.
reviews.title: Mediocre and over-priced coworking space

reviews.text:
great place to work and have good coffee and great smoothies, too. wifi is working fine here.
also a good place to hang out at lighthouse as it is one central spot in dahab.ashraf the owner assists also with organising eg a stay, directions and is helping out with whatever he can do.enjoyed the place very much.shukran

reviews.text:

reviews.text:
We found this 4-in-1 place by chance - a cafe/restaurant/co-working space/diving-windsurfing & kite surfing center. A German owner, Patrick, is so friendly and such a unique character. We kept coming back 3 days in a row because the food was so tasty and everything was reasonably priced. The location is great, a nice change from the crowded cafes by the sea.The restaurant is also very cosy, with the quieter space upstairs. We sat downstairs twice, and upstairs when it was too hot and we needed some good AC. I know it also offers good wifi but we didn't try to be honest. Also, if you love dogs, Patrick has 3 lovely dogs just lounging about.

I 100% recommend this place for a tasty, clean & fresh breakfast and really good coffee too! Not to forget the honey & banana pancakes! Yum! Thank you Patrick & Ashraf!
reviews.title: New Favorite Spot in Dahab!

Now it’s sinai but it’s February so it’s  winter and it’s cold. My phone lives on to tell this story. The food was great the staff were very friendly and Mohammad was extra accomodating great space a hidden little gem for Dahab who take it from me a local of six months now can attest to the standards of this place. Very happy 😊 shukran.
