reviews.title: Best restaurant ever in Dahab

reviews.text:
Очень приятное место. Дружелюбный персонал. Вкусная еда. Уютные столики.
Прогуливаясь по набережной Дахаба, захотели окунуться на Лайтхаусе. Вся первая линия довольно плотно заставлена кафешками, с лежаками или просто со столиками. Конечно можно зайти в воду и в узеньких промежутках между кафуриками, но тогда вещи останутся без присмотра и есть вероятность остаться после плавания без них. Поэтому мы решили заходить в море через кафе. Оказалось, что для того, чтобы это сделать, нужно заплатить 100-150 фунтов, заказать чего-то как минимум на эту сумму, что даст возможность пользоваться лежаком хоть весь день. Но поскольку нас было трое, мы были неголодны и хотели всего лишь окунуться, будучи уверенными в сохранности вещей, ну и может полчасика потом полежать, и идти гулять дальше, нам показалось, что 20-30$ дороговатая цена. Такие условия оказались на всем пути от Иль гардена в сторону моста. И первая кафешка, которая предложила нам плавать, загорать, отдыхать без привязки к сумме минимального чека на человека - Blue House. Мы воспользовались этим предложением и потом не раз возвращались сюда и ещё вернёмся в будущем 🥰. Очень приятный персонал. Уютные столики: обычные высокие или низкие с возможностью полежать, позагорать.  Подзарядка гаджетов. Хороший вход в моря, прямо напротив которого мы встретили черепах 🤩 Ну и вкусная еда. Всем рекомендую, отличное уютное место с очень приятным хозяином Зизо.
reviews.title: Классная кафешка

reviews.text: This restaurant serves up the most delicious sea food in Dahab. Various kinds of Red Sea fresh fish, gambas, clams, squid - all will delight your taste buds to no end. The service is friendly, welcoming and helpful. You can bring your own wine from the local wine store next door. A must if you are a seafood lover.

reviews.text:
The rooftop is quiet and it's nice to sit at the big tables with enough space to other guests.
 
The prices strongly increased within the last year and compared to the price level of other local restaurants, you pay here more. But if you want the rooftop atmosphere and a different type of food, it might still be worth it. 

Today I was a little disappointed: I ordered the grilled halum, which is supposed to be served with vegetables (grilled eggplant). But what I got, was grilled halum on rocket-leaves and 4 small tomatos. I consider this "some salad" and not "vegetables". The waiter said, that's because today they were "out of eggplants" but later he claimed, that they serve it like this since they opened the restaurant, which is a contradiction to his first statement and  clearly not true, as can be seen on pictures on their facebook-page, where this dish is shown with grilled eggplant.

But I also had the "raheb" salad, which was indeed tasty.
reviews.title: nice rooftop place, good but overpriced food

reviews.text:

Definitely recommend if you want to have a romantic night but also if you wanna see your friends in a positive place.

Very rude, I don’t recommend and personally will not go back
reviews.title: Rude staff, average food...

reviews.text:
I would like to keep this beautiful address to myself only. But out of respect for the hospitality of the owner and whole staff both on the floor and kitchen I thought I'd share my experience.

The food comes in perfect portions. The dressing, spices and choice of ingredients are wonderful. I did not want the experience to finish so we came back 3 days later! 

I was amazed by the place, nested on a terrace well protected from the wind by palm trees and bougainvilliers trees (blossoming at this season). Although being antiphone on the table whilst dining
I had to Shazam the perfectly selected tracks. 

I wish you readers an amazing experience. 

Sea you soon Seaduction for sure!

reviews.text:
Gotta try the seafood soup. White not red. Haven't tried the red but the white is delish😋 and the calamari in it is so tender❣️never had it like that. Lightly battered Fried shrimp is also awesome. Cooking butterfly cut eating with hands with friends makes an enjoyable shared meal. They also serve fresh juices. Comes with pita and tahini.  white is delish😋 and the calamari in it is so tender❣️never had it like that. Lightly battered Fried shrimp is also awesome. 

Fish was ok. So were the grilled prawns. I recommend butterfly cut fish and eating with hands among friends (with good hygiene) makes an enjoyable shared experience. They also serve good fresh juices. Just tell them no sugar like everywhere else. Comes with pita and tahini.

reviews.text: The restaurant is clean with nice staff. Nice hospitality and fresh seafood. Prices are not reasonable.

The seafood was really fresh and tasty, well made, and we really enjoyed it.
The salads were basic and ok.
I'd recommend this place.

We ordered and he brought our drinks straight over, glad he did it was warm
Our food came minutes later

We finished and although it was getting busy there was no rush to move us on
We paid and were wished a nice “rest of our day”
Cheap meal, but a nice one

Never again. The worst place on the coast.

reviews.text: Unfriendly staff. The food was okay. We took lentil soup and chicken and it was okay. The hommus tasted like Tahina. The shisha tasted like fire. The chicken mushroom was overall good. Service needs to be better as they did not want to help us even when we asked clarification questions about the menu. Location is very good on the sea directly. WiFi is slow.
reviews.title: Okay food. Bad service. Bad shisha.

reviews.text: This restaurant has a nice view and easy access to the water, but my last experience eating there was not pleasant.  My husband had been at the restaurant for several hours during a diving course.  It was Friday and I joined him after shopping at the Friday market.  He already had his food when I sat down and I handed him a small piece of tart to taste from the market.   Four waiters glared at me and one came over angrily to the table.   When I am asked for a menu he angrily said “No food from your bag!”  My husband explained I intended to order and we would not be eating from the bag but the waiters continued to glare.  It was a disappointing experience and uncomfortable experience, especially considering my husband has eaten lunch there almost everyday for the last week during his dive course.   I won’t be joining him for lunch there again.
reviews.title: Nice view

reviews.text:
We had a terrible experience at (Everyday cafe Dahab). Me and my wife we ordered latte, Turkish coffee with milk, cheese cake and lazy cake. The coffee taste was so bad, we asked the waiter to change it but they refused even after they taste it.the cheese cake and lazy cake were old, tasteless. We spoke to the manager , we returned back the coffe and we ordered lemon juice instead. The juice was good . Surprisingly, once we get the bill we come to know that they have charged us for the coffe and latte , we spoke to the manger and he responded in a careless , unprofessional way that he never received any kind of complains before , and basses on the reviews their standard is unquestionable,he insisted to charge us for the stuff that we didn’t drink. We paid the full amount with complementary tips for the staff and we will never go there again.
مررنا بتجربة سيئة للغاية في Everyday Cafe Dahab. طلبت انا و زوجتي لاتيه و قهوة باللبن ، تشيز كيك ، ليزي كيك. القهوة كانت وحشة جدا هي و اللاتيه ناديت علي الويتر و بلغته كان رده انه هينده المدير محدش جه روحت للمدير و قلتله القهوة وحشة جدا  ، اصر ان القهوة كويسة ، طلبت منه يدوقها و قالي كويسة!! الكيك كان وحش جدا و قديم ، الليزي كيك جه متاخر و كان وحش جدا ، طلبت عصير الليمون بدل القهوة كان حلو جدا. لما جه الحساب اتفاجات انه هايحاسبني علي القهوة و اللاتيه اللي مشربتهمش و كان رده ان التقييمات بتاعته كويسه جدا و ان الاستاندرد بتاعه عالي و انه بيجيله اجانب كتير و محدش بيشتكي. حاسبت علي المبلغ بالكامل و سيبت تيبس للستاف و عمري مهروح هناك تاني.

reviews.text:
What I like about restaurant in general is when the place doesn't offer merely food, but gives you a whole experience: good taste in my mouth, good music in my ears, smilly and welcoming employees, confortable place to eat but also to relax... I found all of this at Seven Heaven Restaurant four years ago and since that time, at any occasion, I come back there to renew the experience. I particularly enjoy the breakfasts offered (the American is my choice, when I don't decide to take a cinamon pancake) but I also highly recommand anything from the menu. You can also ask for special sea food dinner, they are amazing. I tried different stuffs and had been always happy with what I got. On the top of that, the prices annouced are cheap and they are always the same than the one you are asked to pay. 
As the restaurant is not directly on corniche, you have to enter Seven Heaven Hotel to find it!
Let's meet there!
reviews.title: -- Not just food --

photos.caption: Flashy signs that you can't miss
The best chill out place in Dahab
Best place to meet other travelers, divers, food lovers...

reviews.text:
不知道为什么Trip Advisor 把seven heaven 定义成餐厅，其实它是一家饱受中日韩背包客好评的廉价旅店，也是最著名的潜水课程提供处，住宿相当便宜，员工非常友好

当然，这里餐厅提供的餐食性价比都不错
reviews.title: 不仅是餐厅，还是一家友好的廉价旅店

reviews.text:
Жили в отеле Seven Heaven и периодически ели в этом ресторанчике. Хорошее меню, повара готовят быстро и с душой, по-домашнему. Цены очень гуманные по сравнению с береговой линией. Работают с раннего утра и до позднего вечера. Очень удобно если нужно рано утром поесть. Вечером приятно посидеть в chill out зоне с подушками и попить бедуинского чая. Можно поросить кальян. Персонал очень приветливый и дружелюбный при этом искренне а не наигранно как это часто можно встретить в дорогих ресторанах на набережной.
Уютная атмосфера, среди посетителей много простых и интересных людей из разных стран. Есть wifi.
reviews.title: По домашнему вкусно, уютно и недорого

reviews.text: A great way to start a long day of diving. The breakfast’s were delicious as was everything else! I was amazed to see the beautiful young chef take charge of her kitchen. Next visit to Dahab treat yourself to this quaint little restaurant at the Dahab Divers Resort, you won’t regret it!

name: The Vegan Lab
rankingString: #59 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: The best vegan spot to try out even if you're not vegan or hate veggies lol. The crispy tempeh and zoodles pesto salad were my favorites! My friends and I order takeaway a few times and they nailed it every time. Service can be a bit slow sometimes and they only accept cash, which is a pity but the food is totally worth it! Ahh do not miss out on their raw tiramisu, seriously, it's almost too good to be true and always sold out!
reviews.title: Best Vegan Food in Egypt

reviews.text:
Interesting menu with some experimental options.

Another diner recommended the BBQ beanburger which was an interesting and tasty dish.

The staff were helpful and friendly, the restaurant spotless and the ambience very relaxed.  All in all a pleasant meal.
reviews.title: Interestingly presented bean burger

reviews.text: I went to have a noodle tempeh mango salad in the evening. I actually took this option just because it's mango season in Egypt and I needed some freshness. I took it take away and realized when I got home that they didn't put the mango! It was the end of the day and they most probably ran out of it but they didn't bother telling me. The noodles were not fresh at all (and undercooked), the dish didn't have taste at all, I had to add soja and chili sauce to give it some taste. They probably just wanted to get rid of all the leftovers of the day, taking the advantage that I was not going to it in front of them and that I couldn't complain... All of this for almost 10 euros... And that was one of the cheapest options. A proper shame to pay European prices for such poor quality of food !
reviews.title: Terrible cost for value

reviews.text:
Had high hopes for this place as a healthy alternative to the typical Dahab food. Unfortunately, I found the food to be made for nice pictures, not good taste. We tried two of their burgers. The burger componets tasted bland and overprocessed, with a remarkably uniform consitency for the 'cheese', the patty and the bun. Vegan, but definitely neither tasty nor healthy. Can't speak for the rest of the menu here.
I wish the restaurant would focus on more simple vegan cuisine, instead of mimicing meat and dairy products and using fancy (overprocessed) ingredients. I'll stick to home-made vegan meals here.
reviews.title: Overengineered food

reviews.text: I wish this cafe was in Sharm, where I live. The poke bowl with teriyaki tempeh, shitake,mango, avocado, nor, pickled ginger and goodness knows what else was terrific. It's expensive vs other places I eat here but the ingredients and quality are evident.
reviews.title: Excellent poke bowl

reviews.text:
Out of all the oilly street food and tourist traps in Dahab this protentious place managed to get THE FOUR OF US CRIPPLING FOOD POISONING, RUINING OUR LAST DAY OF VACATION. They even managed to ruin tiramisu! And that green "cheesecake"? We would have rather eaten the wooden spoon that came with it! My recommendation to the brain behind this operation: Be humble, just because it looks instagrammable doesn't mean it tastes good, and apple vinegar is not a solution to mask bad food. Basically you could buy 9 delicious meals in the Falafel King or Box Meal if you want to treat yourself like a sheikh with the money that *literally* went down the toilet here. STAY AWAY from this place, unless you are looking for alternative enema.
Sincerely, 
A 6 year vegan
reviews.title: STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS

reviews.text: Lovely restaurant serving healthy delicious food! Was so happy to be able to eat some fresh salad (that’s not just tomatoes and cucumbers) with interesting ingredients and have a nice cold smoothie at the same time. The portions are really big. I felt bad that I couldn’t finish my dish. Price is a bit on the higher end but it’s totally worth it!
reviews.title: Fresh ingredients and delicious food!

reviews.text: Food was very good. Fresh, well prepared, and tasty. Service was below average. Greeted warmly, but that was it. Arrived at 11:30, food didn’t come out until 1:20. No explanation, check-in, or thank you for coming. A little pricey.

reviews.text: Our experience was unmatched. The place has a nice and quite outdoor seating. The food was just marvelous. We ordered the BBQ Vegan burger, it was well-cooked and so tasty. reviews.text: Don't know why this place is so far down the list - its really very good grilled (BBQ) meat, great service, you can bring your own beer in and very reasonably priced. Forget all those samey and overpriced places on the front and hit the back streets! Yum!

reviews.text: the best in dahab great food soup and chicken and fish all is good grilled meats and kebabs excellent food

reviews.text:
Fantastic fresh juices without added sugar and local cuisine. 
Tahina, hummus, baba ganoush, fresh salad, warm pita bread right out of the oven. We really love the beef ribs cooked tender and then grilled over. 
Kofta were juicy and spiced just right . 
Unexpected find - not a TripAdvisor hype as the restaurant next door serving starchy veggies cooked for hours in gravy😉
reviews.title: Excellent local cuisine

reviews.text: We've been regulars here whenever visiting Dahab and always had wonderful grilled chicken and lamb. Just in case, the 'lamb chops' are what we would call lamb shanks and they are served baked with vegetables: a true and tasty feast! If you want grilled lamb chops they are called lamb ribs--and are often irregular cuts but marinated and grilled to perfection. BUT this time the waiter insisted we tried some of the other dishes on the extensive menu--and he was right. The seafood tagine with mushrooms is a dense and extremely tasty mix of shrimp, calamari, bits of crab and chunks of fish seasoned just right so the ingredients hold their own flavour while contributing to the whole.Outstanding. Tonight we are having the lamb tagine. And the prices make this one of the  best value eateries in town.
reviews.title: Best Value Meat and More! Outstanding!

reviews.text: Excellent food which is freshly cooked to order. Situated in the lighthouse area. A variety of soups are available in addition to grilled meats. Decent value and not quite as busy as a notable chicken restaurant. Friendly efficient service with a smile
reviews.title: Grilled meats and kebabs done to order.

reviews.text:
I wouldn't recommend this restaurant at all. The salad sucks,it was pale & not fresh. Kofta full of fat and tasteless, same goes for the sausage. Ribs, to be fair, is good however not awesome.finally, prices were too high for such bad & tasteless food. I did not mention the hygiene aspect of the staff and place, cuz there is none, obviously they never heard about it. The atmosphere was dull & boring.
Overall bad experience, check your other options, definitely will be better.

reviews.text:
there are 2 restaurants/ cafes called  Al Capone in dahab.. This one is at the blue hole. The cafe at blue hole is good spot to chill out in-between dives. I was by myself and they looked after my bike and my bags. 

I ordered the tuna sandwich and it was pretty tasty! Very filling! I did find the drinks a little over priced here though.
reviews.title: blue hole cafe

reviews.text:
We visited this restaurant after a deep two dive in the Blue Hole. We ordered pizza and drinks. The restaurant served us appetisers of fresh Bedouin bread and various dips which were excellent. The pizza was very tasty, very fresh and very inexpensive. 
Generally the overall impression was very positive. I would recommend it too any visitors!

reviews.text:
I can only recommend this place, the location is perfect, the food, the drinks and the staff also for an honest price ! 
Big up to : Collum, Cian, radwa, Ahmed, Mohammed and Yana
reviews.title: Snorkeling and chill

reviews.text: No matter what hotel we stayed at in Dahab we always ended up in Yalah bar. Yalah bar is one of the best places in Dahab to just spend the day sunning, swimming, and drinking. The staff is super friendly and always welcomed us back like family and remembered us no matter how long it had been between visits. The cocktails are nice and the food hits the spot. The beach by the bar is not rocky so it’s perfect for taking a dip between drinks. Look forward to the next visit!
reviews.title: Home away from home away from home

reviews.text:
Very relaxed atmosphere. Just had drinks and chilled for a while. No pressure to leave, just enjoying the view of the Red Sea, that it sits adjacent to.

There are many similar venues along the sea front, but this one seems very popular with tourists and locals alike.
reviews.title: Great Place to Chill

reviews.text:
Popped in for coffee once over a two week stay in Dahab and would never return as they are over priced and offer little quality if compared against other places in the close proximity.

Comments of the staff were what really put me off, queried the cost of the bill, to be told you are from England you are rich!

Rude and incompetent!
reviews.title: Rip off

reviews.text:
Nice view. Nice chilling. Unlike other places, this one had refrigerated beer. Therefore extremely fast service unlike other cafes which have to buy it elsewhere. 

Best review is how busy it is.
reviews.title: Beach without sand

reviews.text:
Ventured in for some dinner and wasn't impressed one bit, over priced food with small portion sizes.. The coffee isn't so great either!

The place next door offers more tastier food and coffee for the same or 50% lower in cost!

Staff are still as great as I remember from my last trip but it looks like others have also figured out there are far more superior places to eat in Dahab!
reviews.title: How the mighty have fallen...

reviews.text:
Just landed in Dahab and feeling that you are in the wrong place?
No problem, the feeling is normal but soon will go away.
Dahab is badly hit by the economical situation in Egypt because the lack of tourists.
Despite of this problems you will be amazed by the peoples attitude and the level of good services they struggle to provide you.
Super F&F = Super Food & Friendly and trust me is not over appreciated. Is not my type of writing.
Yala stuff will meet you with a genuine smile, not a seller one, will make you as cozy as possible, will explain the menu for you in a perfect english, will bring you the food so fast you won't be able to finish you cigarette and will spend time with you and your guests telling all kind of stories. They are the type of people that will never bore the tourists :)
Food is a delight, is not the average food you will be served in hotels restaurants.
Your beverage was not cold enough? Will bring you an extra cold one for free!
 And the surprise comes with the check. 
After a very good meal and a check so cheap you feel absolutely obliged to tip this guys.

Remember that even if the economical conditions of Dahab are atm bad, the people are still smiling and doing their best to make you feel like a million stars vacation.

PS.  : Stir Fried Chicken is a must!
PS2 : Don't forget to save some food for the cats. Any way they will remind you by their presence next to the table :)
reviews.title: Super F&F!

reviews.text:
I spent most of my trip in this bar as it was right opposite my dive centre so brilliant for that post dive coffee and snacks...

I also ate here a number of time, highly recommend the meat shawarma, spicy and full of flavour, as was the burger!

Drinks are cold and refreshing and always served with a smile... The free strong WiFi signal is the icing on the cake!

Service is quick, prices are great and the atmosphere is the best in dahab, typically chilled and laid back.

They even have easy access to the water if you want to cool off from the mid day sun.

I loved Yalla bar and will be returning in future!
reviews.title: Best bar in Dahab!

reviews.text:
Short and sweet: Yalah is one of the places to go in Dahab. Amoungst all the dodgy, loud and flashy places on the boulevard, Yala is the place to have food and drinks. The staff is nice albeit a bit nuts. 

We had really good food. Order the kofta! The cocktails (2 for 1 the whole day..) are strrrrong. We had several and they bite. The bartender has a very loose hand. Strong (local) alcohol is insanely cheap (25 EP for a bottle of vodka in the shops) and it shows. The Long Island Dahab Tea is nasty (in a good way)....

We spent a great few nights there with and without the kids.....

Anyway! Go yala!
reviews.title: Good food and strong cocktails

reviews.text: After the diving we went for the Yalla Bar, because it's just opposite of the dive center. It has also a free wifi connection, serves all kinds of beer. The food it good and has a good tast, but is more basic then a restaurant someway further the boulevard. But prices are also less. It also less clean and has more cats around then usual, but not big deal. Don't get me wrong it's not filty, just less clean then big restaurant on the boulevard. For lunch there is no better place to go, great kebab and small dishes! If you want to relax, do some email and have a chat you don't have to walk any longer!
reviews.title: Good place to chill out!

photos.caption: Left Yalla Bar next to the boulevard

name: Seaweed Suhsi Bar
rankingString: #63 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text:
Wow. An unexpected sight in Dahab as visitors who hadn’t seen the progression of Dahab since we visited last 7 years ago.

A fantastic restaurant, indoors and patio seating. All food prepared to order not sitting in a chilled counter. Meticulous attention to the sushi and other preparations. 

If you don’t like raw sushi there is plenty of tempura so fried and served sushi style. 

Great value. Such a surprise to find but a fantastic place. Thank you
reviews.title: Delicious and freshly prepared

reviews.text: Absolutely DELICIOUS sushi at an UNBELIEVABLY reasonable price. If you like sushi this place is like heaven. We went here twice during our stay and also got a takeaway. We couldn’t get enough as the food was so good and at such a good price. If I lived here, I would eat there every day. Do not miss out, 100% recommend.
reviews.title: A dream come true

reviews.text:
Yesterday Nov 6th 2021, my husband and I went to sharm branch, we arrived at 7 pm, ordered and been told that our food will be served after 20 to 30 min, however, we kept waiting till 9:15 pm, and we asked 3 times when will our food be served, and each time we've been lied to and told that food is coming right now! When I told the waiter that this is taking way too long we've been here for almost 2 hours, and you said food will be served after 20 to 30 min, he unpolitly said, it's not my problem or the chef's, we just have a lot of customers tonight! at 9:15 we saw food being served to another table that arrived after us! And that was when we decided to leave this unprofessional place, and no one bothered to come and ask where we're going or offer a simple apology!
I've been to many bad resturants, but by far this one is the worst of them all, I don't recommend it under any circumstances.
reviews.title: Terrible service

reviews.text: We absolutely loved the sushi we had while in Dahab! It rivaled what we had in Japan. Will definitely go again next year!
reviews.title: Amazing Sushi!!

reviews.text: That was really one of the best sushi meals we've ever had and we are sushi addicts back in Cairo. The food was really amazing and delicious, the place was clean and the staff were friendly and professional. Definitely recommended for anyone who wants to eat sushi in dahab or even try it for the first time.
reviews.title: Amazing sushi!!

💕💕💕💕

name: El Primo Restaurant
rankingString: #62 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: During our stay in Dahab we ate at El Primo three times although there are plenty of restaurants on the same street along the beach. The biggest distinguisher for El Primo is delicious food, fast and friendly service. At Eel Garden restaurant nearby we waited for more than an hour for our food in comparison.
reviews.title: Tranquil location, excellent food!

reviews.text: The situation of this restaurant is really el Primo,  but the owner's attitude to dogs really is not,and put me off. He antagonised both dogs and those trying to care for the street dogs.I had been led to believe there's a good vibe about street animals in Dahab, but not here.
reviews.title: Not for animal lovers

reviews.text:
Our stay in El primo was a very good experience,It’s clean, convenient,worth the price.
Don’t expect a fancy hotel, it’s just primitive but very convenient as you wouldn’t need more than they have.
The breakfast was really good.
And a special Thanks to Mohyie,Bakkar and Hassan.
I will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.text: Located 10 minutes walk from lighthouse centre El Primo provides a cool and relaxed environment straight at the beach! The kitchen is great as is the service. The apartments are clean and good and the price has a good price-value. I go here regularly to escape the usual tourist places in Dahab.
reviews.title: My secret gem to escape from usual crowd

reviews.text: El Primo food and beach-sitting area is my little secret of Dahab......Living here 5 years and sometimes you simply want to be away from the normal 'office'. The food and staff is great, food is healthy and fresh and they offer interesting dishes for very reasonable price in an amazing environment. A good place to chill, relax and enjoy and located at a perfect place to swim (Eel Garden) when there is not so much wind.
reviews.title: my secret place.....

reviews.text: A perfect place; never have I felt more at home. With a beautifully tranquil location, and very good food, this is already an excellent place. But it is the exceptionally friendly Egyptian staff (Achmed and Bakar) that really make this place, they genuinely bond with tourists and share their lives with you, or equally keep a respectful distance if that's how you prefer it to develop. If your looking for an authentic beach place this is it, a few minutes walk and a million miles from the bustle of the centre of town. The Russian hippy owner is mega chilled out, allowing people to do their own thing, play their bown music etc, it is simply paradise.
reviews.title: Idyllic and extremely friendly

reviews.text: We not only stay at the El Primo Hotel we also eat here in the restaurant. We had fresh salad, soup and veggy dishes. We enjoyed our food on the beach. It was prepared with love and always more than enough. The juices been fresh and the coffee was the best for us in Dahab.
reviews.title: delicious fresh food right on the beach

reviews.text:
very nice restaurant, on the beach 
the food was soooo good ,delicious and fresh
very good service 
the staff do their best to make their gusts happy and comfortable      
I really like it soooooo much
reviews.title: Perfect sea view

reviews.text:
Visited whilst on holiday in Dahab last November. The premises look adorable and I couldn't wait to eat there. We went for brunch one day, I had scrambled eggs with garlic & tomatoes which was surprisingly delicious! 
The views are delightful and we will be gong back for sure!
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: During our week In Dahab we found ourselves returning again and again to El Primo. Emily and Hany were so friendly, the restaurant is beautiful and so peaceful, the food delicious. My favourite was lentil soup and tahoubasha ( meatballs ), and my daughter loved the curry and pizza. We were sorry to leave and will definitely return...thank you for a memorable time. ( if they play music it compliments the atmosphere, nothing like the thumping beat elsewhere!)
reviews.title: Fantastic food, stunning views, lovely hosts

location.address: El Melil Street El Primo Hotel Dahab, Dahab Egypt

name: Alcapone
rankingString: #64 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: What a terrible experience that completely ruined my evening. I have no idea how this place has such a good rating. The food was average.. Not exactly the kind to write home about. My partner wanted to order fillet of fish and they said they don't have it but wanted to sell him a whole fish by kgs. We were also told that we can pay by card which in the end wasn't the case and we needed to get a money from an ATM which charges fee for withdrawals. We also had tax added to the bill.. So the prices were not final in the menu but at no point we were told that. It is the worst experience i had of dining out in Egypt and Dahab in particular. I hope people will not be fooled by their amazing reviews.. It is a poor, overpriced experience.
reviews.title: If I could put zero stars, I would

reviews.text: I have been travelling for 2 and half weeks now and this was by far the best meal I have eaten. This may be one of the more expensive restaurants in Dahab but my perfect quality rib eye steak and side dishes were the price of low quality street food in Israel. I had intended to spoil myself on my night and after a couple of weeks without a quality piece of meat but now I will need to return. I was so impressed i just downloaded this app to write a review. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Everything was perfect.

reviews.text:
We cone from Sharm Elsheikh only to have dinner here and back again , the restaurant worth to drive 100 km ,even more ,
Staff are amazing,  place is nice and clean , food is very very healthy and tasty 😋, 

Simply is the best 👌
reviews.title: The best ))

reviews.text:
Very nice outdoor seating area with nice view on the red sea.. 
food was great.. we tried the alcapone seafood soup and it was waaw.. the Caesar salad with shrimp was great .. lobster grilled was delicious..
reviews.title: Alcapone Dahab

reviews.text:
The best grilled food I ate in the long time. All the rest was also delicious.
First time in my life I saw the place, where they allowed to drink your own wine.
They are not selling alcohol, but happy if you bring your own.
Prices are good, cheaper than buffet in the hotel. Very comfortable, nice sea view, the whole atmosphere is good
reviews.title: The best grilled fish

reviews.text:
Complimentary warm bread and dips as a starter and mint tea at the end of the meal were perfect. 
The mains were also extremely delicious, Al Capone seafood soup is definitely the best in Dahab (trust me we tried them all!) 
Pasta and grilled seafood also high quality and well presented.
reviews.title: Seafood soup!

reviews.text: Very nice outdoor seating, food was great, we tried mix grill, mix seafood, various chicken plates, and they were all good. Om ali was amazing too.
reviews.title: Nice place and food

reviews.text: Very good people, delicious food. Nice view and the best shisza. Thanks Mustafa for taking care of my groups. We will come soon.
reviews.title: The best restaurant in Dahab

reviews.text: My wife and I were visiting Dahab and a guy outside the restaurant convinced us that the fish we will choose from the display outside will go straight up to the grilled. We trusted him and get a table by the water, the guy took the fish from the display and promised he is going to cook the fish for us, but he scammed us, he took the fish inside and charged it with another old fish from the fridge, And they charged us over 500 pounds for this fish and some calamari. I am going back to Dahab, but never alacapone again.
reviews.title: Absolutely scammy please.

reviews.text: We didn't feel welcome. The waitress was unfriendly, nearly rude. Anyway, we wanted to try their Russian dishes. The taste was not impressive and the portion size was a joke (especially stroganoff). We left hungry, went to grab falafel sandwich right away.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: The only decent meal we had in Dahab. After a few days in Dahab we realized there’s simply no good food here, everything is below average including top rated places on TripAdvisor. Stumbled upon this place while walking around and found this place packed with foreign tourists which is usually a good sign and we decided to give it a shot. To be clear this is not spectacular food like you would expect in Cairo or any international major city but for Dahab this place is amazing hence the 5 star rating since we’re grading on a curve here. Pizza is edible but Beef Stroganoff and most other Russian dishes are excellent which makes sense since the owners are Russian, dessert was good also. Service is acceptable as is the case with most places in this little town.
reviews.title: Best Meal in Dahab

reviews.text: Tasty food and delicious pizza and the Borsch Soup  is so good , they also have gluten free options and vegan which is good choice

reviews.text: Really really great tasteful food. Various and lots of excellent veggie options. Staff is very friendly and you can even sit next door and order.
reviews.title: Just go and enjoy

reviews.text: The pizzas here are giant and amazing, best I’ve had in Dahab. Service was fast and friendly. I recommend this restaurant!
reviews.title: Great pizzas!

reviews.text: Found this place after 4 long days of eating in tourist traps all over Dahab. This one is Russian owned and offer great lunch and dinner options. Great pasta and pizza, as well as traditional Russian and European dishes, salads and more. Definitely a place to eat in, and return too once in Dahab
reviews.title: Great casual and clean place in Dahab

reviews.text: It is a cozy place with variety of options to order. Never tried Russian food before. I had beef stroganoff, it was delicious 😋
reviews.title: I love it!

reviews.text: We enjoy visiting Dahab regularly.  We go 4 to 5 times a year and Red Cat is one of our favorite spots and typically hit it up a couple of times while in town.  It's freshly prepared, healthy, and in a great location to visit with with family and friends while people watching.  Furthermore, it's unique.  Many of the restaurants in Dahab have very similar menus, but Red Cat is different and delicious.
reviews.title: UNIQUE AND ENJOYABLE

reviews.text:
Nice location, lovely breakfast with nice varieties. Very fast service. The food is fresh and the coffee was amazing. 
We chose our breakfast and pastries then paid for it. In a couple of minutes the food was served at the table we chose. 
Friendly staff and it was very busy. 
Highly recommended
reviews.title: Fresh and tasty

reviews.text:
Nicely updated since my last Dahab trio with more tables and good displays to help with your selection.

Great pastries and donuts for breakfast and freshly made sandwiches for lunch mean my Dahab trips always include more than one trip to Ralph's.

Savoury and sweet pastries are each delicious so there is a different option for each day.

The turkey salad sandwich was delicious and large enough to save half for later in the day rather than eating it all for lunch.

Coffee is good too.
reviews.title: Excellent bread and pastries

reviews.text:
So we went there twice for eating in and the other days (7 or 8) for take away:
 
Bakery: If you order your pretzels (Bavarian: Brezen) and Croissants and other delicious stuff for take away as in a normal bakery, the quality and taste are pretty fine and authentic. Try the almond Croissant these are good! The Ciabatta is not really what an Italien would call it, it tastes more like a Milkbread.
The Cappuccino is like all over Egypt too hot.
But overall a decent quality.

Eating in / Breakfast: well of course you can order the above mentioned things separately. But normally you will order a "breakfast" menu. For my personal taste there was way too much ham on the plate compared to the one piece of bread. The described cheese was different than served and I had to order aditional butter (because they only serve one per guest).

The next time we will come back.
reviews.title: Depends - eating in and take away

reviews.text:
I ordered the full English breakfast for 130 le.
This makes it the most expensive breakfast I know of.
It comes with two bread rolls and one small frozen packet of butter. I needed another butter and asked for one.
I was absolutely shocked to be told I would have to pay an extra 10 le for a second tiny packet of butter after already paying 130 le for the breakfast. 
Will not go back.
reviews.title: Expensive for what you get

reviews.text: A great bakery, perfect for breakfast or brunch. Lovely cakes and they even do a decaf coffee with non dairy options. The only place I could find in Dahab that serves decaf.
reviews.title: Great bakery with decaf and no dairy 😃

reviews.text: Ordered a full English breakfast it arrived at my table cold the mushrooms were cold the beans cold and I believe the potato wedges were from the day before. I took it back inside and 5 mins later it was brought back to me. Beans still cold and minus the wedges. I ate what I could then after eating my last baguette from the basket found the bottom to be running full of ants. I wanted to throw up. Obviously the basket full of breadcrumbs hadn't been washed. Would never go back and did not even get an apology.

Look at first we thought okay it’s not bad, but when you try other places in Dahab offering Chinese food, you quickly realise the food here is at best average. Service was a little slow also.

We are here once and never returned.

reviews.text:
If you are considering to eat here, definitely do so! 

Probably the best service I've ever had and I have traveled quite a bit in Southeast Asia. You can really feel that the family owning the business love what they do. The owner gave us very personal recommendations and we were overwhelmed by flavors. 

The food was exceptional, Asian with some interesting twists. You should definitely get the sha bi eggplants, their salad and both desserts, the fried bananas and the fried ice cream. They also have many vegan options.

The vibes are very chill and stylish. If you sit on the roof terrace, you feel transported into a different world, especially at night time.
reviews.title: Best food and service in Dahab

name: Ali Baba Restaurant
rankingString: #9 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text:
We were recommended to go to Ali Baba by a local Egyptian friend and he was so right. We couldn't believe the amount of amazing starter plates ( 10 or 11!!) Which come free with your main course order.  Service is fantastic and friendly and the experience is amazing. The sea food specials come out of the kitchen on a massive wooden boat that takes 2 waiters to carry. Someone was having a birthday which was celebrated by a parade of waiters carrying a cake and flaming candelabras and much dancing ensued around the birthday person's table. 
All the food was delicious and we were offered mint or bedouin tea before our hand washing ceremony which takes place at the table. 
We went back for an equally great meal and would highly recommend this restaurant. Price for 2 including water was about 700 Egyptian pounds in March 2023 which is fantastic value.
reviews.title: Amazing value, service and attention to detail

reviews.text:
We ate here twice while on vacation and hands down it was one of the best restaurants in Dahab. The food, the service and the atmosphere; just perfect.

Lobsters are getting overfished in this region with no law enforcement to protect the lobster population. We have seen lobsters as small as 1/8 of a kilo in some restaurants elsewhere. This restaurant refuses to buy and serve small lobsters and is making an impact in the conservation of the lobster population in the area. kudos to environmental conscious management.
reviews.title: Best Restaurant in Dahab

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our meal at Ali Baba...my grilled whole fish was so fresh and nicely seasoned, and the appetizers were great. It's a fun place to come with a group,  for a birthday or just a night out on the water!
reviews.title: A festive fun place with great service and fresh fish!

reviews.text: Very overpriced in comparison to adjacent cafes and restaurants with the same or even better quality food and service.
reviews.title: Scam

reviews.text:
My family and I were part of a group that ate here after a dive at The Blue Hole and Canyon dive sites with Pyramid Divers.  What an awesome atmosphere. Loads of traditional Egyptian flat bread for starters (they even made a few for one of our group without sesame seeds due to allergies). The meal was genuinely fantastic - I had the lamb koftas and would recommend that, although the rest of the party all raved about their meals. Meal portions are substantial.

The view from the outside deck is beautiful as it overlooks the bay. The breeze that comes through is a welcome respite from the heat. Seating outside is on large couches, and is very comfy. Part of the charm of the outside dining is that there are cats that wander around and make themselves comfortable on the couches. No need to worry, they don't harass you for food and stay off the tables.

After a day of traveling and diving it was great to just sit back and relax.
reviews.title: Great Venue and Food

photos.caption: Cats add to the ambience. Cute, and not pushy.

reviews.text: Mashraba has a really nice scene and this is part of it. Their patio is Always full at dinner time. It is very popular. And they probably have the best falafel wraps around❣️I recommend it with their green hot sauce. It's more tangy than hot. Very casual. No pretenses here, folks. Just enjoy the food😀

reviews.text:
I have been in Dahab for over a month and go to Yum Yum almost on a daily basis. 
In my opinion it is among the best cheap/budget food options I have found so far, and especially around noon it becomes quite busy, also with locals.
The food in general is simple yet tasty and almost exclusively "Egyptian Fast Food" meaning a lot of it is fried (falafel, fried vegetables, ...).
However, it is also possible to eat relatively healthy by picking single non-fried dishes and as far as I have seen all their food is vegetarian/vegan.
The two main ways of ordering are either in sandwich form, such as a falafel sandwich, which is best suited as on-the-go/take-away option or by picking single dishes (e.g. fried eggplant, mashed-potatoes, beans, tahina, moussaka, shakshouka, fries, salad, ...) plus flatbread.
Prices can vary, as there is no proper menu but I have payed roughly 10 EGP for a sandwich and about 60 EGP for 4 platters of different dishes plus bread which is enough for 2 hungry people.
If you are looking for another place, smaller but with similar dishes and prices which is located more central in the lighthouse area I can recommend "Falafel King".
reviews.title: Very Good Value for Money

reviews.text: We went to eat lunch with my sister, expecting nice cheap food. The food was ok, nothing amazing. We were very surprise when we paid the bill. 15 pound a very small plate of fries, or of 8 falafel! So total 100. Im quite sure we overpaid as we look as "tourist"...

reviews.text:
I came here when it first opened and would visit at least once to add variety to our evening meals. I wasn’t overly impressed until now… 

A friend told me to try it one more time so we did and wow!!!

The quality of the food and the flavours have improved significantly, it’s as close as it can be to bring an authentic curry! 

The flavours, spice and taste were all on point, truly 5 stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

The dal makani was sensational, deep flavours and so good that we came back at least 5 times again just to have it with the freshly cooked rice! 

The chicken curry was also really nice, would have liked more pieces of chicken in the dish but again tasted awesome!

Highly recommend nameste for Indian food if you are in dahab! 

Oh and it’s super affordable too!
reviews.title: Tantalising curry’s full of flavour!

reviews.text: Awesome dinner. Not too pushy outside like some of the other places. Understood coeliac completely. We chose our fish and seafood and they made an incredible platter with it. reviews.title: Coeliac friendly. Super fresh fish!

reviews.text:
My friend and I went on a trip to Egypt in May 2022 and stayed in Dahab for a couple of days for the Mt. Sinai hike. We will always remember how amazing our experience was at this restaurant and how friendly and hospitable the waiters were. From the moment we went in for dinner, the waiters were at our service and kept checking in to make sure we had everything we needed. The food was just delicious, the portions were generous and the view was beautiful! There were many options to choose from. The decor inside the restaurant was very shabby chic and we both loved it. 

Our second night there, we were walking along the street buying gifts and souvenirs and to our surprise one of the waiters called out for us (we’re from Canada and Mauritius and he was saying “Canadian! Mauritius! which was so funny haha) and invited us inside for some ice cream and drinks all on the house! They refused to let us pay and wouldn’t even let us tip! 

This review is long overdue but having dinner at Nemo restaurant is one of our most memorable moments in Egypt and we can’t wait to be back one day. Thank you so much to all the waiters at the restaurant for being so welcoming and kind ❤️ 

Sincerely, 

Canadian and Mauritius ❤️
reviews.title: Amazing experience!

reviews.text: The place has a wonderful sea view. The service was very professional. They offer you a large bottle of water, bread and different types of salads like tehina, garlic sauce, hummus…..all that for free. As for the dishes, we were four and ordered several plates like salmon steak, lemon chicken, cordon bleu and grilled shrimps. The food was delicious and the portions were quite enough if you are so hungry. At the end, they have a very nice tradition as they bring you a big plate with a jar full of water and lemons to help you wash your hands. The only comment is that the restaurant is really expensive compared to some other restaurants in database
reviews.title: Excellent food

reviews.text:
Wonderful food! Best we had the whole vacation. 
We ordered the fresh fish and they were Amazing! 
Would definitely recommend!
reviews.title: Amazing food!

reviews.text:
Firstly the very warm and friendly greeter helped organise to exchange money at a great rate. I had recommendations of another “best seafood” restaurant but thought I’d try this one. 
I’m so glad I did, when I returned that night the greeter was very helpful to explain all the fish and recommend one. Then I’m seated and promptly served the most delicious dips and bread, the flavours of each dip were perfect.
Then our came the main course, the fish and shrimp grilled to perfection with a smear of some basting sauce that added beautiful subtle flavours while allowing the full flavour of the fresh fish to shine.
Even the rice was a taste sensation, so delicately flavoured and absolutely delicious. 
This was my first meal in Dahab and the best so far. 
Finally the bill came and it was very good value. In subsequent restaurants I paid more and they didn’t match the perfection of the fish nor the explosion of subtle flavours.
If you love seafood I would recommend you don’t miss this one!
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: Food was excellent, service is slow but very attentive, well worth the wait. You choose your fish up front, choose the way it's cooked, ambience is amazing. Right on the water, great music and feel inside. Staff was easy to communicate with and pricing was very reasonable. Really wonderful!
reviews.title: Excellent food, relaxed atmosphere

reviews.text: Excellent food and staff were really wonderful and welcoming and generous. The food was delicious and portions were very generous. We had the lamb fatta and various mixed grills over our two visits and were given complimentary meze and breads to start as well as dessert and tea the end.

rankingString: #5 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: Omg was amazing place i will return again there i spent alot of good time for one day also sharm was amazing and i spent time at sharm
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: We are two 50+ couples on holiday in Dahab for a week. So far, we have eaten twice in this restaurant, and since it offers such a wide variety of excellent food, we will probably eat in there at least twice more this week! The owner of the establishment was courteous and couldn't do enough to make us feel comfortable; a really nice gentleman. We took our own alcohol with us as the restaurant isn't licensed; this seems to be acceptable in Dahab. So, the total of our check for 2 courses each, plus a complimentary dessert was approximately £35. The meat spring roll was completely misrepresented in its picture in the menu. It was similar to a large long samosa cut into slices. It was delicious. I had moussaka for my main course, and again the traditional moussaka photo in the menu looked nothing like the actual dish (which was the best moussaka I've ever had). A rich meaty sauce with loads of aubergine piled on top; it was amazing. The owner provided us with a complimentary plate of small donuts to finish. The view across the bay and the moonshine across the water were unexpected delights!
reviews.title: First Class Egyptian Hospitality (and Food!)

reviews.text: Good view, food is OK, staff are friendly.  Good place to relax and do some work while drinking a coke or two.
reviews.title: Good views

reviews.text: We were deceived by the friendly waiter and the low prices, in the end it turned out that the waiter wanted a big tip, and we had to pay for the high service in addition to the food prices. We ate pizza and pasta. I can't remember the last time I had such bad pasta with cheese. I can hardly say that the pizza was good either. The waiter treated stray animals very badly. He poured water on the cat and wanted us to do the same. The absolute worst decision we made in Dahab. The location cannot make up for the terrible experience we had.

reviews.text: This place has definitely been my favorite place to eat here in Dahab. It’s not super busy, in a quieter area of town and has fast service. Well lit, great food, and relaxed seating areas right next to the crashing waves. If you come at the right time you can see the moonrise over the Saudi mountains.

name: Shark Restaurant

reviews.text: We ate here twice during our week long stay at dahab. Front of house wasnot too pushy compared to other rsteraunts but the selection of fresh fish was tye best.  Very genuine service with bread and plenty of dips to start with.  Although they dint sell alcohol they will let you Bring your own choice of wine and provide ice bucket and corkscrew. reviews.text: We’ve eaten at Shark Restaurant at least five times in three trips to Dahab, including twice this time. They never fail to create a delightful evening. The food, usually seafood, has been excellent every time. The atmosphere is great, right by the water, with what I guess are local decorations. The staff seems to have a positive harmony and energy between them. They always make us feel special, and we know it will be a good meal and a fun time.  They understand the art of customer service. H
reviews.title: We enjoy it every time!

reviews.text:
I've travelled to Dahab a couple of times now and this place never fails to serve good food with excellent service. I most recently travelled with my two teenage boys in December and we ate there three times and had take out one night.
The atmosphere and decor is welcoming and comfortable. The staff are always happy, attentive and ready to help.
I also love that they feed the cats at the end of the night. 
Good people

reviews.text: my husband and I went to eat dinner one day and it was so good we ended up going for lunch again the following day! the service is amazing, the view is excellent, the food very tasty and the cost very reasonable. we paid 30€ for 2 people and had both starters and main course and drinks. the water is complimentary, definitely recommend!

reviews.text: Foodies delight with ambiance and music to match. I was thrilled to visit Dahab after 15 years and see Shark restaurant has withstood the test of time. Arguably Dahab's most professionally run kitchen and staff. As a vegetarian, there were plenty of options. Gourmet cuisine with Sinai and Red Sea flare.
reviews.title: Foodies Delight on the Red Sea

reviews.text: The whole experience is very very good. You get greeted by nice waiters and get escorted to the table. You get an awesome starter with really amazing bread (have never tasted anything alike in Dahab) with 8 sauces. I tell you...you will be in it for a treat. We had grilled calamari with fries and they were really good. At the end they come to wash your hands with lemon. The prices are normal for the area. We payed for our dinner 450 E.P.. Would definitely recommend having a dinner there.
reviews.title: Amazing dinner

name: ZANOOBA Slow Cooking
rankingString: #1 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: Have rolled back from the most incredible evening here. The food was stunning - beautifully cooked and so, so tasty. The surprise dessert was also one of the best I’ve ever had. The owners are also wonderful and friendly and such a nice atmosphere - please visit!
reviews.title: Truly delicious food in a wonderfully welcoming place

reviews.text:
Honestly… it was mega mega yummy in my tummy! 
Never had such warm soul food prepared with love and passion for taste. 

Even the salad upfront was so surprising in it’s spice choices. We ate the whole pot and of course we had to try desert. (We couldnt resist) 

Holy moly heart warming! 
Will definitely come back.. already looking forward trying a different slow pot. 

Please treat yourself and taste it all
reviews.title: Mega tasty good soul food!

reviews.text:
My friend and I went for dinner at Zanooba and even though I had been a few times before, it was beyond my expectations. We had the mint lemonade, an incredible salad, the duck meal and Thai veggies AND the most incredible dessert I’ve probably ever had. It is all homemade with love and is the definition of comfort food. Healthy, slow cooked, authentic and bomb!!! 

Go here, go often! 
Thank you Karim for an incredible experience!
reviews.title: Excellent food

reviews.text:
This review is for anyone who is not familiar with the food scene in Dahab because if you are, then you would definitely know that Zanooba Slow Cooking is one of, if not, the best place to have a superb meal specially after a long day-trip dive to Thistlegorm or a 60+ mountain climbing experience in the mountains of Genay Valley. 

Back to Zanooba - it’s best to book ahead of time in order to get the best stuff they get their hands on. If you’re into seafood, then you have to go for the squid and fish mixed pot. Mine had a red snapper alongside the squid in some magical red sauce and veggies. Another one to try is the honey garlic chicken as well. What makes Zanooba Slow Cooking stand out though is their ability to engineer their meals to match what you are thinking of indulging in instinctually like the last time they served us this insanely tasty date tart with ice cream on top. 

Their secret ingredient is their consistency across the years. A must eat.
reviews.title: The GOAT of restaurants of Dahab (So far…)

reviews.text: Our most expensive and worst meal in dahab, seriously lacking flavor… chef didn’t even bother to ask how the food was… rice wasnt cooked long enough and was hard in parts
reviews.title: Over rated —

reviews.text: Zanooba had been recommended by us to pretty much everyone in town - and they weren't wrong. Karim and his team dish out absolutely delicious food including vegetarian options that is well worth the minor hassle of ordering ahead and the (very short) walk away from the promenade/tourist-trap-ish restraurants. The portions are large, the food is great and the service is phenomenal - including any extra assistance or advise if needed. Zanooba will definitely become a staple in our future visits to Dahab. Give it a try. You wont regret it.
reviews.title: Worth the wait

reviews.text:
Zanooba is my favorite place in town and the food is to die for. after enjoying the Honey garlic beef a few times I now am obsessed with the duck. 
The food experience is just incredible and the host is amazing. I 100% recommend trying it out
reviews.title: Best culinary experience in town

owner_response.text:
Thank you very much, dear guest,  for this sweet review 😊 
We're glad that you enjoyed, and looking forward to your next visit. 
Greetings, K&K, ZANOOBA Slow Cooking
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text:
Good, but way overpriced!

The food is tasty, but much too expensive. We ordered turkey. In the pot for 2 people we got one medium sized turkey leg. The vegetables were very simple (mainly potatoes and carots) with a large bowl of rice on the side. For this we paid 36 Euros !!
We defentily would not do it again. There are much better meals for less than half the price in other restaurants in Dahab.
reviews.title: Our meal at Zonooba

owner_response.text:
Dear Bpaki,

The fact that you didn't read the menu that was sent to you, nor see the prices written on the wall at the venue, and didn't order, according to what you can afford, is not our mistake. 

This information is for those who read this review, and the subjective statement about our prices: 
our most expensive main course is 16 € (or the equivalent in EGP at the official exchange rates for the day); the Slow Roasted Stuffed Duck is 14 € per person, and the rest of the main courses cost b/n 7 to 12 €; salads-  3 to 4 €, desserts- 4 €. 

K&K, ZANOOBA Slow Cooking ✌️
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: This is a real gem, an unassuming resteraunt found in the back street away from the beach front has to be searched for but is definitely worth it. Unlike us , you should book a day in advanced as the food really is "slow cooked" and should be ordered a day ahead. We were lucky and there was still a good choice of dishes from stuffed roasted duck yo honey garlic chicken. You should definitely try the apple salad,  who new a salad could taste this good.  The deserts are also not to be missed. Average freshly and above all enthusiastic chef and front of house  topped off the best resteraunt in dahab.
reviews.title: Not to be missed

owner_response.text:
Thanks a million for the warm words, and the great review. We're looking forward to your next dinner with us, 
Greetings, K&K, ZANOOBA Slow Cooking 🌹
owner_response.title: Owner Response

reviews.text: I don’t understand how Zanooba Slow Cooking could end up as TripAdvisor’s No. 1 Dahab restaurant. We’ve vacationed in Dahab three times, and most restaurants we tried had better food, prices, atmosphere, and, not in the least, service. We had Zanooba’s roast duck, which was okay, but didn’t live up to the hype. The setting was nice, small, and intimate. Service, on the other hand, was limited to plopping a heaping clay pot of food in front of us without a word. On the wall next to us was this quote from the Kurt Vonnegut novel Jailbird: “You can't just eat good food. You've got to talk about it too.” Really? They certainly didn't live by that creed. Even though the place was half empty, no one said a word about the food or their slow cooking process. Maybe Zanooba thinks their food speaks for itself. It doesn’t.
reviews.title: Didn't live up to the hype!

owner_response.text:
Thank you, Doug M, 
For your time, and efforts to write us this interesting review. Your highly subjective opinions matter, and we are sorry we didn't meet your expectations. 
Next time you want to communicate with us about our food- do so! We are always welcoming and willing to have a talk with our guests, but we don't go to each table insisting on having your attention. 
We know we cannot possibly make everyone happy, yet we'll keep trying. 
Greetings, K&K, ZANOOBA Slow Cooking
owner_response.title: Owner Response

Pizzas are by far the best pizzas in town, so if you are a pizza lover you should absolutely put this pizzeria on your check list. I also had amazing coffee which is hard to find. The waiters are nice and polite, always with a smile and make you feel welcoming. Would come again! Good job.

reviews.text: The ART of Italian food! As simple as that! One of the best restaurants I’ve ever been to. The taste, the ambiance, the super friendly staff, the speed of service, the friendly pets around, the music … all were just PERFECT!

reviews.text:
Average at best, place is nice, we ordered 2 pizzas with fries, pizza were average at best, simple 4 cheese ones. Check your bill as they slap on a 10% service charge.

reviews.text:

name: Eel Garden View Restaurant
rankingString: #3 of 158 places to eat in Dahab

reviews.text: The Eel Garden View Restaurant was a very nice surprise. We only stopped their because it was close to our AirBnB apartment. Excellent food, generous portions. friendly service, great value for money and a casual and relaxing atmosphere. At some of the tables nearby, people were sipping tea and surfing online. It’s right on the beach, with big glass windows inside and places to sit on the beach. Nice music. On top of it all, it was probably the cheapest place we went for diner during our week in Dahab.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise!

reviews.text: My daughter and I loved this place. We went there for just a drink & snack during the day and felt comfortable just relaxing reading or having a swim. We also visited in the evening for food. We particularly loved the mashi and tagine. The owner and staff were always so welcoming & friendly and nothing was too much bother. We even had something cooked for us that wasn’t on the menu (as we asked about it) I also had a week to myself in Dahab and felt equally very comfortable sitting in Eel Garden alone. Such a special place 🙏🏽
reviews.title: Welcoming. Relaxing & delicious food

reviews.text:
Best restaurant in Dahab ❤️
Great food,great location,great service and staff.

reviews.text: we had a two week stay in Dahab and visited Eel Garden many times. The atmosphere is relaxed, the food is delicious and the staff are great. It's a great place to spend the day chilling out on he beach meeting new friends.

reviews.text: The restaurant is a little off the main street, the location is quiet and pleasant. We ate hummus, shish kebab and chicken with lemon. The food was okay, but really nothing special. It seems to me that quite a bit of spices and salt were missing. This is also the only restaurant where the waiter struggled with English. The prices are reasonable, you actually get a full plate of food. I would recommend the restaurant if you are in that part of the city, a little closer to the center you can easily find something better for a slightly higher price.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text:
Friendly, relaxed restaurant with table seating or beach cushion style options right on the beach.

The vegetable pancakes were nicely presented a also very tasty.

Dishes being served to other diners all looked very good.

I will return on a future trip to Dahab.

reviews.text: Perfect place for a relaxing dinner - good service and nice ambience with live music. I can recommend the grilled fish, the juices (ask for home made ones) and desserts.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Shams Hotel for Christmas and New Years 2021-22 and athade many of our meals at the restaurant (all breakfasts and most lunches, and a number of dinners). The restaurant terrace is a lovey place to sit and listen to the sea and pet the cats while waiting for your food to arrive. We were impressed by the cooking: overall the servings were generous and the food really good, the burgers and the shis kebab in particular. No license for serving alcohol but no restrictions whatsoever for the guests to bring their own, and glasses and corkscrew provided.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

reviews.text: Staying at the Shams hotel and diving with them- we spent many, many hours at the restaurant as well, and had most of our meals there. Really nice relaxing atmosphere, decent food, helpful staff.
reviews.title: Shams Restaurant

reviews.text:
After our diving went to Shams for lunch. Was very quite ,  just few people . In my great surprise it took quite long to food arrive. But then again there was only one boy working . Soup (lentil) was very nice , we enjoyed it very much, but fried calamari was horrible. Too chowing, I did not like it at all , but of course our Dahab cats enjoyed it. 😂😂. Overall was nice place, great view again 😊
Will go back , yes I will…
reviews.title: Feast  with cats

reviews.text:
Have you decided to travel to Dahab and not planning to visit Shams….then better don’t travel!

Professional, disciplined, master of hospitality owner of Shams…..an amazing rare man Osama Shams who knows all the ins/outs of hospitality industry talents and knowhow 

Maie, The Lady, who is the restaurant manager, that hardly to meet a F&B manager like her…taking care of the little tiny details of service and customer care

Food is delicious….drinks refreshing and ambiance is just unique 

Again…going to Dahab….then don’t miss Shams Restaurant!
